author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3869, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1705774154}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257291154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1704374722}
review: Bloody Trapland is my favourite all time rage platformer, and a blast with friends local or online. The best part? (Excluding a tiny set of levels) the game is PURE SKILL, you will retry a section THOUSANDS OF TIMES until you can perfect EVERY movement, EVERY button press, FRAME AND PIXEL PERFECT, and be off by 1 subpixel and die... BUT THE NEXT RUN WILL BE BETTER AND YOU WILL GET PAST IT! The controls are INCREDIBLY tight, every move you make has an instant effect and the moment you release it, it STOPS, gives it this unique tight feeling of being so very much in control yet still so very hard. Trying to 100% this game is 100 levels deeper than the deepest hell this game normally presents, something I still haven't gotten around to. And then you add friends into the mix... Bring a couple of controllers and sit by the couch, this is gonna be fun. People griefing eachother left and right, popping off when they finally do a hard part only to die soon after, everyone rejoicing when we beat a hard level, some dude waitting at the end for everyone else to get a taste of pain, boosting or pressing buttons for others to make it easier, and that's just the main mode! Honestly griefing in this game is it's own ruleset, crouching won't allow you to get stomped (in normal levels) and if you're good enough you can juke a jump from your friend to land on THEIR head it's like rock paper scissors. It has community created levels which I have barely even begun to explore as I'm still playing the normal campaign, and everything about this game just OOZES passion, ABSOLUTELY MUST BUY! (Criminally cheap). So sad the online servers need a workaround to barely function, we either play local or steam play together. And even more sad the sequel does not carry AT ALL this game's core DNA.

review:
Bloody Trapland, oyuncularƒ±n i√ßinden ge√ßmesi gereken √ßok sayƒ±da tehlikeli tuzak ve zorlu atlayƒ±≈ülarla hƒ±zlƒ± tempolu bir oyun sunan heyecan verici bir √ßok oyunculu platform oyunudur. Oyun 100'den fazla seviye sunar ve hem √ßevrimi√ßi hem de yerel olarak d√∂rt oyuncuya kadar destekler, bu da onu kooperatif oyun i√ßin m√ºkemmel bir se√ßim haline getirir.

Oyunun en heyecan verici √∂zelliklerinden biri, oyuncularƒ±n kendi seviyelerini olu≈üturmalarƒ±na ve arkada≈ülarƒ±yla payla≈ümalarƒ±na olanak tanƒ±yan seviye edit√∂r√ºd√ºr. Bu √∂zellik oyunun tekrar oynanabilirliƒüini artƒ±rarak fiyatƒ±na g√∂re √ßok deƒüerli bir oyun olmasƒ±nƒ± saƒülƒ±yor.

Bloody Trapland ayrƒ±ca √º√ß farklƒ± oyun modu, sadece co-op ve gizli alanlar, √ßevrimi√ßi skor tablosu, d√∂rt oynanabilir karakter ve benzersiz bir m√ºzik sunarak oyunculara saatlerce oyun oynama imkanƒ± saƒülƒ±yor.

Bu oyun, ister sƒ±radan bir oyuncu ister sƒ±kƒ± bir oyuncu olun, t√ºm beceri seviyelerindeki oyuncular i√ßin m√ºkemmeldir. Zorlu oynanƒ±≈üƒ± sizi saatlerce eƒülendirecek ve daha fazlasƒ± i√ßin geri gelmenizi saƒülayacak. Genel olarak, Bloody Trapland arkada≈ülarƒ±yla oynamak i√ßin heyecan verici ve zorlu bir platform oyunu arayan herkes i√ßin m√ºkemmel bir se√ßimdir.

review:
[h1] Super Meat Boy in Coop [/h1]
Es ist eine Mischung aus Super Meat Boy und Unfair Mario. Ein Spiel was schwer ist, aus viel Geduld besteht und unverzeilich ist. Das ist Bloody Traplands. Simple Mechanic, man hat WASD und das war es auch. Ich habe es im Coop durchgespielt den da kann man sich auch noch gegenseitig t√∂ten. Meistens Ausversehen, manchmal auch Absicht. 

Ich empfehle das Game wenn man viel Geduld hat.

[i]Kaufempfehlung? Ja![/i]

review: A repetitive, tedious and unnecessarily hard game. The developers straight up grief the players after some point with random shit like the fireballs which just ruin runs and have random patterns and the fake block traps which insta kill you if you step on them. This game is an achievement hunter's nightmare and the only thing it has to say about itself is '' haha look our game is hard ''. Also the multiplayer this game advertises doesn't work, you can only play solo or local, which sucks the fun out of the game even more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155952394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1625867260}
review:
Decent platform game, at least for singleplayer, but really hard, you'll die A LOT.
Tried it on multiplayer with 2 friends in coop mode (it has online mode and works pretty good) but it was a lot more frustrating (as if it wasn't frustrating enough) because we kept colliding on each other, due to this some stages were too hard even from the start.
Haven't played the VS mode but it's a lot more fun than coop, that's for sure.
All in all i still recommend this game if you like challenging platforming games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199269606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1656303306}
review: Looked like fun, wanted to play it multiplayer but it doesn't work. The only way to play multiplayer is to either open up/foward ports or use a 3rd part program. The game itself isn't boring, actually fun but I bought it because it marketed itself as a "fast-paced multiplayer platformer" where you can " Play co-op with your friends or take on the challenges on your own. With support for up to 4 players at once, local and/or online." taken from the games description on Steam, but to me if a game says it is multiplayer then I shouldn't have to go through any hoops to play with friends. It is NOT a multiplayer game unless you use 3rd party stuff for it, which could be said for many other games that allow mods; if the game itself at launch can not let me play with friends then it is not a multiplayer game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139521739', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1656303041}
review: Bought the game because it has itself listed as online co-op, assuming I could play with friends. Entered the game and couldn't for the life of me figure out how to invite a friend. Went digging and found out the only option is to host your own server and open/forward a port. I could probably set it up if I really wanted to but when a game [i]specifically[/i] markets itself as a multiplayer online game I don't feel like I should need to jump through any extra hoops for setup. Shame, looks like a fun game but the whole appeal was being able to do a platformer with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561199026991884', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1659754054}
review:
This is an amazing full-length metroidvania-style adventure game. It has a level of production value accompanied by set features that puts this game in the top tier of all fangames for me. Aside from the fact it's a well made metroidvania, it comes complete with a map system, experience points / leveling system, fast travel mechanics, and a non-linear stage design that makes it enjoyable to explore.

Not only are the stages configured non-linearly, but at various points in the game it gives the player the freedom to explore and fight some bosses in the order they decide to as well. Combine this with the fact that there are also extra hidden areas, and you are looking at a roughly 10 hour long adventure or more on your first playthrough.

From a gameplay perspective, the platforming is fairly mild in terms of difficulty, which not only makes the game accessible to non-fangame players, but shifts the focus more towards exploration. Each of the games various areas each has their own theme as well as platforming gimmicks which adds a nice variety as you visit the stages. Mixed into things are some puzzles, none of which seem overbearing, and some of the more cryptic ones have hints to be found in the game at certain spots. The bosses throughout the game are pretty reasonable, and if you get hung up for some reason, you can explore elsewhere for upgrades or grind out a few damage-ups off the monsters.

Overall the game is one of the few fangames that is of a quality level that you could charge money for, and one that everyone who loves adventure games or metroidvanias should play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259821622', 'num_games_owned': 2705, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 996, 'last_played': 1653396230}
review:
[h1] Bloody Trapland  [/h1]

[h1] Dificuldades, sangue, desespero‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.Divers√£o‚Ä¶ [/h1]

Bloody Trapland √© um game de plataforma de precis√£o onde controlamos um dos 4 gatos dispon√≠veis, com algumas op√ß√µes de gameplay, mas para mim sua principal √© o modo aventura, que √© onde temos v√°rias fases e mundos e podemos complet√°-las sozinho ou com um grupo de 4 amigos.
Aqui existe a minha maior reclama√ß√£o com o game, √© extremamente dif√≠cil de jogar online com seus amigos, para isso √© necess√°rio abrir uma porta espec√≠fica entrando no roteador e afins, por sorte, o remote play da steam funciona relativamente bem, desde que a internet do anfitri√£o e dos convidados sejam boas.
O game √© bem desafiador e ao mesmo tempo extremamente engra√ßado, no modo coop existe friendly fire, que se um amigo pular em cima do outro, este explode voando sangue e tripas para todos os lados, o que pode dificultar a gameplay, ao mesmo tempo, jogando em coop, existe a possibilidade de ‚Äúbugar‚Äù o game, como um amigo tentar deixar a mira de uma arma nele enquanto o outro tenta passar.
No mapa do game, temos diversos caminhos para tomar, sendo uns poss√≠veis apenas em modo coop e outro no modo solo, e o nome das fases come√ßam bem normais, mas se tornam bem engra√ßadas enquanto avan√ßamos na gameplay.
A gameplay consiste em pular, mas temos diversos tipos de pulos, uns mais fracos e outro forte, e a dificuldade deles se mant√©m em apenas termos um bot√£o para todos os pulos, ou seja, a intensidade do pulo varia da forma como apertamos o bot√£o, se apertarmos forte, o pulo √© alto, se apertarmos levemente, ele pula mais baixo, e isso numa situa√ß√£o de desespero, √© dif√≠cil para uma [spoiler] CARALHO [/spoiler].
No final fica o selo ‚Äúcaf√©zinho‚Äù de qualidade para este game, que apesar de ser um dos games mais estressantes, dif√≠ceis e complicados que eu j√° joguei, tive diversos momentos onde eu chorava de rir com amigos, me sentia incr√≠vel quando passava alguma fase e apesar de tudo, tem um √≥timo senso de trabalho de equipe [spoiler] Quando n√£o estamos nos matando iguais loucos nas fases [/spoiler].

author: {'steamid': '76561197985261396', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1178, 'last_played': 1653340231}
review:
I started this game in 2014 with a friend in Coop Mode but we never finished it, because we got stuck in one level..
And now, 8 years later, I came back to finish this adventure!

It's similar to Kaizo Mario Hacks, but with cats and more pixel blood. It starts easy but it gets pretty hard in the later levels. Be warned, there are many "troll blocks" that appear out of nowhere.
There are 3 Modes (Adventure, Race and Deathmatch). All of them can be played in Coop with up to 4 Players (Online and local).

In Adventure, there are 6 worlds with 73 levels. 5 Worlds have secret exits.

In Race Mode are 6 worlds and 10 level per world, so 60 in total.
Every level has a time limit but it resets everytime you die. You can finish the level without being intime but if you want to go for 100% you need to finish it intime to get a star.

Deathmatch is pretty much self-explanatory. Get more kills than your friends to win the game.

If you're familiar with Kaizo Mario and have a high frustration tolerance, then this one's for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073563860', 'num_games_owned': 1234, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1649674405}
review:
Beat the game to prove a point that I don't just need to "git gud" before this review.

They have a fun game set but frequently step on their own toes with awful design decisions. An ice world? Losing all horizontal momentum if you bump your head? Stages that require precise timing but don't reset the traps so you learning said timing is awkward and inconsistent (5-10 I'm looking at you a lot here)? The occasional random level clearly made for co-op that is impossible in singleplayer (world 4-4x2)? Buggy spikes that don't load in until after your initial death so you can get 75% through a stage in your first run then suddenly struggle to get 25% through? Fireballs that come out of lava, go downwards to potentially hit you again and go invisible behind lava making them harder to dodge by reaction, oh also they don't seem to have a pattern with nearby fireballs to make them harder to time? The entire existence of 6-9?

Furthermore for every firm but fair level there's another with literal esoteric bullshit that you can't know unless you've already gotten through the level before like blocks in the floor that crush you, fake blocks you can walk or fall through and basically any stage with multiple teleporters.

Also for some reason the difference between a long and short jump is super inconsistent which fucks up a lot of levels and makes performing a VERY carefully timed and spaced long jump in places clearly intended for a short jump the more consistent method for harder levels.

I came off very few levels feeling like I'd improved and solved the level, I ended up feeling more like I got lucky. Maybe I'm criticising a game designed to just be youtuber bait too much, but for my money this just wasn't worth it. The ¬£1.39 on sale is maybe reasonable, but ¬£3.99 is too much. I wish I cleared the game an hour earlier so I could refund it.

Also don't say "it's fun with friends lol" since every game is fun with friends, that's why they're your friends because you have fun doing things with them.

review:
Great game, sadly the multiplayer is a bit scuffed. Sometimes it works with Hamachi, sometimes it doesn't. Wish there was a Steam Direct connection option.

Other than that, you probably won't make it through the game if you can't 'cope' with hard games. It's really hard and will take some time to get through. Was hell of a lot of fun for me but I'm a sucker for hard games. Got it as a 4-pack for friends and I think they already broke after 2 hours of play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998404426', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1649066935}
review:
[h1]BLOODY TRAPLAND[/h1]
[b]tl;dr[/b]
Rating: Very Bad
Clear Time: 5~ Hours
100% Time: 10+ Hours
Summary: Quite possibly the most frustrating platformer I have ever played, Bloody Trapland is an inconsistent, frustrating and unfair platformer who's entire intention is to show you exactly what bad game design looks like. Inconsistent hurtboxes, random timing on obstacles and unplaytested levels makes me wonder how the developer even let this be released AND was allowed to make a second game. It is HOWEVER relatively fun if you have a friend.

[i][b][u]What is it?[/u][/b][/i]
A platformer focusing on difficulty. An adventure mode with 60 levels, a race/speedrun mode with another 60 levels and a deathmatch mode for the dead multiplayer.

[i][b][u]What I Liked[/u][/b][/i]
I played through the adventure mode entirely in co-op and it was relatively fun playing with a friend. Being able to complain constantly about the levels to someone while simultaneously feeling proud of either one of you for completing an obstacle you've previously spent 40 minutes on is a good feeling.

[i][b][u]What I Didn't Like[/u][/b][/i]
This is more of a [i]What's wrong with the game[/i] section. Where do I even start? You have to port forward to play multiplayer (2013 isn't that long ago, this is stupid). Race mode, the dedicated time trial mode, doesn't even show you the time you have to beat on screen, nor the time you're currently doing, nor does it even show it when you beat the level. You have to go back to the menu to find out if you got the star. You can't change levels online without your friend being kicked out and you having to rehost. There is enormous input delay.

Those are all minor compared to how FRUSTRATING and quite frankly bullshit the obstacles are. There are other reviews mentioning the fireballs but I need to explain why they're unfair. They spawn from lava pools and shoot upwards (the distance they shoot upwards is random each time!) then fall down the entire level (through all floors and walls). There is no telling when they will spawn, there is no timing nor pattern. Many levels have upwards of 4 fireball spawns in a row. You'll be running along the floor and just instantly die to a fireball. IF the level is in an "S" shape and you start at the top with fireball obstacles, you will have to worry about those fireballs the entire level because they will fall through the entire level. Getting past the spawn point does not make you pass the obstacle. They are in all situations RANDOM which is a cardinal sin in platformers. NOTHING should be random in platformers because it eliminates skill. It got to the point where me and my friend had to pretend the fireballs didn't exist and just play the levels pretending they weren't there because there was no point; you couldn't time them or wait them out. You either luck out passing them or you die. Every. Single. Time.

But that's not the only obstacle. This is one of those "hidden smash blocks in the walls" games where you will have no idea they even exist until you run over them and they kill you. You can't outrun or escape them, the moment it comes in contact you will die. They are also often placed at the end of levels so if you spend an hour getting to the last 1/3 of a level get ready to die to a hidden block! Gun obstacles fire bullets so tiny they're almost impossible to see. Your character is larger than most obstacles, meaning you need very precise movement to fall through spikes or land on tiny platforms. Saws or maces that follow a path speed up or slow down depending on how long you've been in the level (WHY?) so you can't just memorise timing like every other platformer, you have to adapt to the broken mechanics. Obstacles don't reset upon dying either creating instances where (especially in race mode) it becomes impossible to pass an obstacle unless you wait upwards of 20 seconds.

[i][b][u]What I Would Add/Change[/u][/b][/i]
Get rid of the fireballs entirely, random obstacles have no place in platformers. Decrease the size of the character. Make obstacle movement CONSISTENT and not change. The level design itself isn't even bad, it's just that the developer thought it would be a good idea to cram as many obstacles in each part of the map as possible.

[i][b][u]Personal Thoughts[/u][/b][/i]
How the developer was even allowed to make a sequel is beyond me. This game was not play tested because the final levels are straight up unfair. This game is the equivalent of smashing your head against a brick wall until either you die or the wall collapses. The $2 I got this game on sale for was more than I should have payed. The fact the developer hasn't even fixed the issues this game has had since launch is insane. Check out some of my screenshots of this game if you want to see what poor game design is.

[i][b][u]Achievements[/u][/b][/i]
You have to 100% the game, which includes gold starring all levels in race mode. The final 10 levels are almost impossible to complete in time because they throw so much obstacles at you it's borderline psychopathic. If you have the mental willpower of a Tibetan Monk then you can 100% this but if you EVER get any kind of anger playing any game than stay far away.

review: This game's side effects are nausea, limb pain, headache , diarrhea and many more. Game was fairly easy but when I entered the 6th world ,shit just got real. the second half of the last world is very very hard - You have to inspect the patterns , grind timings into your muscle memory. Last level was so hard that we spent like 3 hours trying to finish it. Truly the Dark Souls of platformers. I really enjoyed this game with my friends. If you're looking to have "fun" with your friends, certainly give it a try. Platformer wise 8.5/10 from me. Cheers

author: {'steamid': '76561199021996935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1708858207}
review:
Cute Cats & Lot's of BLOOD.
Bloody Trapland is a difficult single screen platformer.
Your mission is to get to the goal or to the secret goal, if there is one.
Pretty simple, but there are a'lot of deadly traps, that kill you in one hit.
No worries, since you have unlimited lives and there's no time limit.
However you are going to put your jumping skills to the test.

You have single player game & multiplayer in same screen.
Four player max, each player having their own character and you are playing at the same time.
There's no pushing other players, so you can stand in the same small space if needed.
However you can kill others with jumping on them, which can be used when you are in fight against them.
There is also a co-op mode where you try to defeat this game's levels together.

This game has a level editor as well, BUT it's a very mixed bag.
Making your level starts easy and you can share these with others on Steam.
However game doesn't explain things for you, so you need to practice & test thing out, which I recommend.
Also you can ONLY test your level by quitting level editor, subscribe to your level and play it in game's custom levels mode.
Not to mention that the editor is buggy, so there can be some error happening in the actual game, like graphical issues.

This game does support controller, which I highly recommend.
There is online & local multiplayer, however I haven't played on online, so can't say how well it works.

I recommend this game to anyone, who is looking for challenging platformer or fun multiplayer.
Remember though that this game is way more fun when played with friends.
Making levels does get fun, once you have learned how it works.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065954158', 'num_games_owned': 2081, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1643199056}
review:
Bloody Trapland is mostly a fair game, and that's what's important in a Guy game like this.
Do note the 'mostly' up there, as it's why this is a negative review. In later worlds, in addition to obstacles like spikes, arrow traps and crushers, you also begin to deal with fireballs. At first glance, this is a neat new trap to avoid. In practice however, fireballs make the game significantly more irritating. Not difficult, irritating. Where with other deaths you can always see where you went wrong (barring the occasional Kaizo trap hidden in the floor or ceiling), fireballs have absolutely no warning whatsoever, and are unpredictable (i've heard hearsay that fireballs *do* have a cycle, but either that's a bold lie, or the cycle is so disjointed from every other trap that it is effectively random anyway). Making your way through every trap in the level, slowly learning the path through, only to die from effectively the game giving you a middle finger is *severely* demotivating.
Game before fireballs: 8/10; little bit of jank, but great game otherwise
Game after fireballs (W5 or so): 4/10; an exercise in frustration because i'm now too invested to drop it like it deserves

author: {'steamid': '76561198183941367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1642568607}
review: Once one reaches beyond the irritating CD key gateway they will understand Bloody Trapland as nothing more than a novelty expense. Ripe with maps curated not to challenge, but to kill, players are subjected to low-effort level design that offers little progression or gratification. Adding another layer of brutality is the server quality. Your connection is only as strong as your group's weakest link (internet, not skill). Mindless and time consuming, Bloody Trapland will leave you gazing anywhere else.

review: This game is excellent, the controls are tight, the level design is great... it has traps. My only complaint is how easy the game is, I don't think I died even once throughout the whole play through; I mean, you're a cuddly kitten with a monocle and a top hat... it's kind of a super easy game for kids but with saws everywhere. Anyway, buy this game

review: Bloody Trapland is quite the most difficult and most frustrating game I have ever played. It is fun for those who enjoy challenges; however, the multiplayer feature is really bad and needs improvement. Whenever I'm in multiplayer, I always get booted out (which can result in glitches). The ending had glitched for me when I was playing with someone. He got the achievement and the end cutscene... and I didn't. Overall, it may be your type of game if you enjoy challenging puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116100475', 'num_games_owned': 4712, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1626627036}
review:
This is a very frustrating game if you are playing by yourself, but it is a great, fun game if you have at least one person to play with you (I played this with my Brother). If you enjoy platformers, then grab a friend and play this game.

World 5 is where it gets really unnessecary in terms of difficulty. At that point its not "Hard" its just frustrating because of invisible objects crushing you etc. World 5 and beyond is just: "Learning the pattern that the level needs in order to complete" and it sucks but bearable with a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264336974', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1629153564}
review:
It is a game that is designed to make you rage to begin with, however, there are some flaws that make you angry simply because it is poor game design.

For example, there are offscreen lava bubbles that could kill you at any moment. A simple indicator would solve the issue but now you are killed almost randomly. There are also spinning saw levels, where each saw is set at a different speed, so you need to wait minutes for the perfect moment just to get one attempt. My biggest frustration is that there are two jump options, both using the space button. For a high jump, you hold spacebar normally, but for a short hop, you tap spacebar quickly. In a frustrating game like this one, I often press down on the spacebar hard even though I just wanted to short hop, often making me lose. This could be avoided by adding separate buttons, but no, there is no option.

This was one of my first games bought off of steam, and if I knew there were a refund option, I would of refunded it immediately. But since I didn't do that, I am really feeling the regret as I am an achievement hunter trying to get this game over with.

I hear the drums echoing tonight
But she hears only whispers of some quiet conversation
She's coming in, 12:30 flight
The moonlit wings reflect the stars that guide me towards salvation
I stopped an old man along the way
Hoping to find some old forgotten words or ancient melodies
He turned to me as if to say, "Hurry boy, it's waiting there for you"
It's gonna take a lot to drag me away from you
There's nothing that a hundred men or more could ever do
I bless the rains down in Africa
Gonna take some time to do the things we never had (ooh, ooh)
The wild dogs cry out in the night
As they grow restless, longing for some solitary company
I know that I must do what's right
As sure as Kilimanjaro rises like Olympus above the Serengeti
I seek to cure what's deep‚Ä¶

author: {'steamid': '76561198195056967', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1627170076}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

author: {'steamid': '76561198347791795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 468, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1651178087}
review:
maybe i am a masochist ? nah nah i just like a good challenge,i like to test my own limits,not a masochist at all nope not me jokes aside this game isnt as hard as i expected it to be its still hard dont get me wrong it is really hard and im just on world 3 of the game and there is like what ? 6 worlds ? yeah i probably wont be finishing this game its hard but its fun if you want a simple but challenging game then this one is pretty good buy it and play it get some friends too if you can im sure itll be tons of fun

+the soundtrack is really good
+the game plays well the controls feel responsive the sounds are good and the game looks good too seeing everything turn red is kinda cool (tho i gotta say after a while seeing all the blood on the traps can become a bit boring,a bit repetative)
+i do like the characters you do have 4 player coop you dont NEED it but you have it which is great the game is already fun and im sure itll be a lot more fun (and easier) with a friend
+i do like the maps you have some secret levels that you can unlock which i think is pretty cool
+the game is hard the controls are simple but the levels can be challenging it doesnt feel unfair even though sometimes it looks unfair (but i have to admit it feels like there is a HUGE amount of luck involved which i guess i should have expected but i didnt expect it so realizing that the game wasnt all about skill and there was a lot of luck involved did kinda ruin the game for me i still like the game i got what i wanted from it so im happy but before buying you guys should know that in this game there is a lot of luck involved too after i realized that i was like "oh okay i guess that kinda makes sense" so its not really a problem for me but for some others it might be a problem im not listing this as a negative point cuz personally i dont mind it but ill still talk about it so other people can know about it before buying the game)

-fullscreen is a problem you have a setting "fullscreen:ON/OFF" the problem is that you dont have a resolution setting so if you turn fullscreen on and its in the wrong resolution then there is nothing you can do about it just play without the fullscreen
-i was going to talk about how the game was lagging every now and then but apperantly it was lagging cuz i had something downloading in the background so i got that fixed and the game is stable 50-60 FPS now (which is basically a miracle with my PC) but i gotta say this to people that might not have a good PC in this game FPS matters A LOT the difference between 40-50 FPS and 50-60 FPS is HUGE there were times where i died in a level cuz i couldnt tell if my character was in the air jumping from one platform to another or if he was falling down about to get impaled on a bunch of spikes those small FPS drops really fucked me up i cannot imagine playing this game with 20 FPS man if you think that your PC might not be able to run this game then dont buy it dont bother this is a rage game and playing a rage game with low FPS sounds like torture to me im pretty sure that the Geneva Convention does not allow this i mean just think about it playing a rage game with low FPS ? oh god what kind of a devil,what kind of an asshole would do something like that ? go and do some CBT instead man youll have more fun
-there are some bugs for example sometimes you can just get stuck on things i got stuck on a cannon once and immediately got shot,another bug i found was there is a certain type of cannon which can lock onto you so it has a red laser when it sees you it locks onto you and starts firing at you it locks on,2-3 seconds pass and it starts firing at least thats how its supposed to be but every now and then it will lock on to you and immediately start firing idk if this is a bug or if its supposed to be this way if this was intentional but i dont think it was i think it is a bug so yeah some bugs exist they are not game breaking but hey they do exist

the game is pretty good its hard,its challenging,its fun and its pretty cheap especially on a discount if the game looks interesting to you then buy it at a discount you might like it but be aware that this is a rage game im sure you already know but ill say it again its a rage game its hard and its supposed to be hard so please tape some pillows to your walls,put your monitor behind some glass and use your old,kinda works but kinda doesnt keyboard and mouse so if you break your keyboard and mouse you wont be breaking your good keyboard and mouse youll be breaking the old ones

Ademas, la interfaz fue dise√±ada por un experto y programada por otro experto ya que funciona todo genial. El modo multijugador UNA JOYAAAA, nunca vi algo igual.
Recomiendo que gasten su dinero en esto.

Por cierto, el juego es una bosta, no se si se capto la ironia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134105180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2159, 'last_played': 1679969730}
review:
Bloody Trapland is the most frustrating game I've ever played.

I'm going at this review as someone who has completed all achievements, yes even the dreaded Gold star achievements.

the music is an absolute Delight although some tracks get very tiring like the castle track.  but besides a couple of repetitive songs it's really great. some of the music is up there with Super Meat Boy levels of fantastic.

the graphics are very minimal, but that's not a bad thing. as with most of the game it feels like a parody of the older Super Mario Bro games, pretty charmingly simplistic. this works for me cuz of all the other stuff you're going to need to pay attention to. one of the highlights of the game is seeing how messy you get the level before it ends. it goes from being a nice tidy level to a complete messy disaster, very satisfying.

the controls and movement are very simplistic and fluid which is essential for a precision platformer. you have complete control, you can stop at a dime then run at full speed again in a Split Second. you have a basic run, crouch and a mid-air jump if you run off a platform without jumping.

you can easily play the game single player without missing out on too much, although playing with friends will always be superior. this game works great for local multiplayer I haven't tried it online so I can't comment on that but the local multiplayer is great, and I've had no problems with it.

the difficulty is mostly great. you have the basic learning, trial and error, timing and execution. the game itself isn't trying to help you, with the many unpredictable hidden Crusher blocks at the end of levels. don't get me wrong this game is very difficult, but if you are experienced in this genre you for the most part should be able to get past most levels if you keep at them. but some levels go too far in my opinion you may end up spending hours and hours trying over and over again, then just as you reach the end after hours of trying a hidden trap kills you. this is quite possibly one of the most depressing feelings ever. if you have anger issues or get very disheartened DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME (or at least don't try and finish it)

the adventure game mode is the best one and the one you want to start off with. just get to the end of the level alone or with your friends and you're on to the next one.

the race mode is pretty simple as well. you and your friends try and get to the end of the level the first one to get their wins.

the battle mode is complete garbage. it isn't even worth mentioning I'm just doing it for the sake of being thorough.

the time trial mode is the most mixed for me. I love time trials in games, slowly perfecting your run and competing on leaderboards. but I don't think it works in this game, the gold stars specifically have a set time you need to complete the level in. the levels itself is hard enough just to complete, yet alone complete in a very limited amount of time. especially with all the very specifically timed obstacles, it gets you throwing caution to the wind and saying "screw it I'm going now" and inevitably dying. as you can imagine this makes it a lot more difficult, and at times literally impossible. doing this brings the game to a masochistic level of difficulty.

I love this game, it itches that scratch of finally beating something you thought was impossible. if you're into that, I fully recommend specifically Adventure Mode world 1 through 5. and if that's not enough for you and you want to complete it or God forbid get all of the achievements, all I have to say is good luck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082419386', 'num_games_owned': 3621, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1598383525}
review:
Bloody Trapland is a platformer, where you need to reach the end of the levels, avoiding dying in brutal ways.

The game graphically is well made, it contains gore which is looks decent. Also, the different enviroments looks good in the game too. I didn't saw any visual bug throughout my playtime.

Controlls are really easy. You need 5 buttons to play the game and you can play with controller too, but I recommend playing with a keyboard. Works like a charm!

Music and sounds are okay at first, however for me, later become bit repetitive, because of the few different sound effect and just a few music per world. However, it's still okay.

Gameplay wise, the game is simple as it is. As I said, you need to reach the end of the level, avoiding the death. There going to be different things will try to kill you or make your job harder, for example escalators, sawblades, teleporters, fireballs and lot other. Also, you need to think about the way to complete the map, because being a Rambo in this game is not ideal. It has 6 different worlds in the advanture mode, and in the first 5 worlds, you can find secret levels too, however you need friends to reach those.

And yes, you can play this game with others, completing the Advanture mode together, or doing Deathmatch and Race. Race is a new set of levels on similar worlds like in Advanture mode, and you need to reach the finish line first. Deathmatch is what it is... because in this game, you don't have weapons, but your leg... because you can kill anyone if you jump on it's head... one of the most annoying thing in the game, if you gut "fun" friends. Races are fun, however I didn't liked Deathmatch... it's probably because of me.  

Difficulty in the game is ramping up quite good, not just in the Advanture mode, but in the Race mode too. However, the last set of levels were incredibly hard, and you need every drop of tears, sweat and blood to complete it, but it's not impossible.

For me, Bloody Trapland is a good "rage" platformer game, where everything is precision. However I recommend you to find others to play with you, thankfully Remote Play is support this game, so that could be a good way to use for this occasion. You can play it one time atleast, but after that the Race and Deathmatch mode could give you more. However, for 10‚Ç¨ the game is a little bit expensive, so I suggest to buy it at sale.

review: It's an entretaining game but the game with a controller can get annoying since the same tap of the button can get you different results, sometimes you get a small jump and sometimes it is slightly higher which wouldn't be a problem if the game didn't relied so much on really precise jumping with flappy bird like spaces making it hellish to complete most levels in the game specially the latest levels, also the fact that as far as I saw there is no option to disable other players killing you if they stomp on you makes it more annoying to play this game with friends so the more people you play this game with the worse it gets, if you can get it on a sale and want to play it solo sure its something I would recommend for the people that love those platforming hell games

review: The level design can be quite frustrating, especially later on in the game. And the controls are fairly sloppy given the level of difficulty. It would be an objectively bad game if it were singleplayer only. Yet once you add other players, this game becomes addictingly fun. I can't explain it. It's not even a cooperative game, more like a race to see who can get bragging rights. Anyway, worth a try if you have friends to play it with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082883105', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1638992516}
review:
Bloody Trapland

Um jogo que voc√™ passa levels fazendo parkour, falando parece simples, mas na pratica nem tanto.
No come√ßo √© tranquilo mas perto do final vira um caos, √© armadilha para todos os lados, bolas de fogo, espinho, um bloco que te esmaga, portais que te trolam e te faz voltar pro come√ßo, √© meio que nesse nivel.

Se voc√™ for jogar esse jogo, jogue com amigos, porque se voc√™ jogar sozinho voc√™ vai passar muita mas MUITA RAIVA.
Mas veja pelo lado positivo, voc√™ e seus amigos v√£o literalmente rachar de rir de tanto bug engra√ßado.

Nota:8.9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198147126260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1588718852}
review:
Prima che mi diciate qualsiasi cosa: ho platinato il gioco, tutti e 29 gli achievements di Steam e di conseguenza tutto il gioco stesso.
Purtroppo i contro sono molti di pi√π rispetto ai pro, a partire dai comandi, se mi proponi un precision platform (che √® uno dei miei generi preferiti) allora i comandi devono essere impeccabili, come su Celeste o Super Meat Boy (anche se in questo caso siamo pi√π vicini ad un Cat Mario visti i blocchi nascosti). Mentre qua sono troppo imprecisi, talvolta non vengono neanche recepiti, e in un genere dove tutto √® calcolato quasi al millimetro...
La modalit√† storia non l'ho trovata troppo difficile ad eccezione di qualche livello in particolare, e mi √® sembrata una cagata incredibile dover essere in 2 giocatori (minimo) per sbloccare alcuni passaggi extra e quindi alcuni achievements, e se te lo stai giocando da solo? Semplice, player 1 con il joypad e player 2 con la tastiera e cerchi di far combaciare tutto perfettamente, per la maggior parte di questi livelli ci metterete due secondi, ma per alcuni invece vi lascio immaginare.
Ed ora veniamo al nodo pi√π grande, la modalit√† Race, molto probabilmente questa modalit√† se giocata in pi√π giocatori risulter√† divertentissima (cosa che non ho potuto provare), ma effettivamente quanti livelli sono stati fatti per essere giocati in pi√π giocatori visto l'aumentare crescente della difficolt√†?
Aumentare della difficolt√† che se combinato con le sfide a tempo dei vari livelli genera un mix di bestemmie & parolacce incredibili, guarda caso gli achievements delle sfide a tempo non sono stati fatti da quasi nessuno, neanche una stella!
Per non parlare di bug come blocchi che puoi compenetrare quando sei sdraiato oppure lame che dovrebbero andare alla stessa velocit√† mentre in realt√† una va leggerissimamente pi√π lenta dell'altra (o pi√π veloce) e quindi ad un certo punto vi troverete con due lame che vanno a braccetto, facilitandovi cos√¨ il livello.
Per carit√†, √® un gioco vecchio, e scemo sono io che l'ho giocato solo adesso, ma come sar√† stato soggetto di critiche appena uscito, lo pu√≤ essere anche adesso.

review:
[h1]NOT RECOMMENDED SOLO; RECOMMENDED WITH FRIENDS[/h1]

Bloody Trapland is a [u]terrible, unbalanced and fairly unpolished 2D Platfomer[/u] with garbage controls and no fun factor when playing SOLO. 
To truly experience the fun of this game, you [u][b]MUST play WITH FRIENDS.[/b][/u] This game has multiplayer functionality so you can play with friends, and, the fun part, you can kill your friends. This instantly makes the game extremely fun, even though it is still bad.

Difficulty wise, the game has a fairly high difficulty with a lot of tight jumps, further made difficult by the controls and movement physics.

[h1]Overall Rating: 4.5/10[/h1]
[h1]Difficulty: 6/10 (9/10 w/ friends)[/h1]

review:
Once upon a time I had joy when I played video games. I believed that the world was full of kind compassionate people who loved one another and peace would prevail...

This changed when I decided to play this game. How can a loving God allow his children to be put through such torture?! it's like getting kicked in the balls while having spicy taco bell diarrhea 

I no longer fear death, torture, suffering or isolation for this game has put me through the depths of pain that a soul can endure. I am no longer human, but an unfeeling ghost. 

10/10 would play again

author: {'steamid': '76561197998574036', 'num_games_owned': 1785, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1618129769}
review:
This is one of the only things I can think of that I wish I could give a neutral rating to, but as those would not influence the overall quality of the game, I sadly have to give it a thumbs down, and recommend those looking to buy it exercise caution when doing so.

Conceptually, the game is a very good idea: a platformer that rewards observation, tactics, and timing. While I praise the concept, the execution leaves a lot to be desired. For starters, most of the timings, if there even are any, are wildly difficult to decipher, and often times require a tonne of time to have synchronise in a fashion that even looks like it can be navigated.

This ties into my second complaint, that being that some levels are rather difficult to decipher, and often require a lot of trial and error, and many, many frustrating deaths before you're finally able to push through everything, and wind up reaching the end. This trial and error nature extends to what I consider to be the biggest, most senseless black mark against the obstacles of the game: invisible kill blocks

The name should clue enough into what the nature of those obstacles is, but for those who would like a more in-depth explanation, certain levels have at least one block that is visually indistinguishable from the rest of the terrain that will shoot up, or come crashing down faster than anybody can ever hope to react, and kill you outright. If such a thing could be seen, then that would be an opportunity to reward observation, but alas, as they're hidden behind a normal looking square, the only way anybody can possibly know they're there on first playthrough is to have their attempts cheaply foiled by them.

This obviously is of no fault of the players', and I truly have to wonder why nobody, at any point in the development cycle stopped to think pf how cheap, unfair, and needlessly punishing this was. It's true that you can get lucky and bypass them entirely, and also that once you know they're there, it falls to you to commit their locations to memory, but seeing as how you need to die to them in order to be wise to these locations, my criticism still stands.

I have yet to get to this part, but multiple reviews also cite at least one location where randomly-timed fireballs occur, necessitating that RNGesus smile upon you to make it through to the end of the level. In a precision platformer, there's no reason at all for such a thing to exist. I hate to compare this to a game I've not played at length in over four years, but in super Meat boy, when you enter a stage, not only can all of them be seen and avoided without being surprise killed by them, but the timing sycnchronises in a way that lets you through. In Airscape: Fall of Gravity, another stuipidly-difficult platformer, obstacles' timing could be deciphered.

Even if you do know where everything is, and how to avoid it, though, you'll likely still feel that luck is more attributable to your successes than skill, pattern memorisation, or observation, as it seems like, on multiple stages, obstacles, and in multiple instances, the hitbox of a kill plain extends a good 5 - 7 pixels beyond where the sprite ends. I know not if this is just the fault of the framerate, or if things actually do have strange masking, but either way, I can think of more than 15 instances where I've been seemingly killed by the air next to a spike.

Even disregarding this, though, another issue rears its ugly head, and another that has no business being in any game that requires precise movement. This beast of which I speak? The abysmal character handling. While most of the time you stop where you let go of the controller, there are instances where it felt like the characters moved too fast to bypass an obstacle reliably, and that you needed to plan ahead with the movements so to speak, to be able to stop where you wanted to. 

This, however is a small gripe compared to the arbitrary rollercoaster that is jumping. Like some other games what sadly aren't coming to mind, tapping the button gives a short hop, and holding it allows one to jump higher. Unlike those other games, which seem to only have two distances that a character can cover, this game allows for that, and everything inbetween. While this may initially sound like a blessing, it requires you to be painfully precise with the held duration of the button, as just a nanosecond can mean the difference between getting through, and becoming a shower of red particles.

The fix to this is so obvious, that even I was able to think of it as well: simply have a dedicated button for short jump, one for long, and, if really necessary, one for medium. As it stands, only one of the face buttons on controllers is used to increase elevation, and the same rings true for the keyboard, which has even more to choose form. So many deaths had seemed like the fault of the bizarre handling, that I wonder if any extensive playtesting of the levels was done to see if they were possible with skills alone. 

Literally the only reason I can think of for why there's only one jump button, outside of making things as ridiculously difficult as possible, is so that co-op could be simplified. Even this falls apart, though, as player 2, when using just a mouse and keyboard, can be controlled with WASD, and the Cursor keys.

Speaking of co-op, I appreciate that it allows for both local, and online, but what's not appreciated, is that some of the optional secret levels require two players to get to, and some of the secret stages themselves, notably in world four, necessitate either insane multi-tasking, or two people to be there. This, though, is if the player first has a controller, and secondly, if they figure out pushing Enter on the keyboard causes a second local player to appear. For those without local friends, online friends who own the game, and those of whom only have a keyboard, it becomes substantially less plausible to 100% the title.

It is precisely because of these reasons that I implore anybody who stuck with this for as long as it took to read to here exercise extreme caution when buying the game, and only do it if they are absolutely positive that it could be somewhat enjoyed, as, for all the flak I shot at it, I still have the masochistic drive to get all the achievements. Maybe this is due to the fact doing so means I'll never have to play it again, or maybe because I'm just a glutton for punishment, but nonetheless, I do have some positive things to speak about, and figured it would be better to end the review on a positive note.

First up on the list of pros is the art style. I rather enjoy how colourful everything is, and how the characters have unique, identifying characteristics, in addition to the separate colours. as far as I know, they all handle the same, which is a positive design choice, and makes things at least fair to everyone. The fact that a stage is complete after only one of the players reaches the end is also merciful, as that means the luck is pretty evenly-distributed. I'd be remiss to not also mention that the fact they went with anthropomorphic felines also adds an interesting twist.

On the topic of the stages themselves, the fact that each world in Adventure mode has its own aesthetic, and that some of them even mix things when approaching the next area is a nice touch, and shows at least some attention to detail. The music that accompanies each of the worlds also differs, with them having a track for the levels themselves, as well as the overworld map. The stages themselves, while devoid of checkpoints, are also all isolated to a single screen, meaning the amount of unfair, luck-based shenanigans you have to wade through to see the next bucket of misery is kept to a minimum. 

I already have the sequel, and only hope that the developers learned from the criticisms of this one, but readers of this one wanting to hear my thoughts on that will have to wait, as I want to be through with this first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074754643', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1580068578}
review:
Bloody Trapland is a very hard platformer with pretty basic mechanics and very responsive controls, thus making it fun even though it's hard is it rarely feels unfair and after mastering a new stage, you slowly begin to accept that, in fact, most unfair feeling parts are just incredibly hard. The graphics are a nice pixel style, fitting the game perfectly.
The learning curve is nearly exponential, you start out with very easy maps, which slowly ramp up in difficulty at first, but then seem to overload each new level with even more deadly shenanigans. 

It's the perfect game for all those, who like difficult platformers and redoing the same level hundreds of times, as it feels very rewarding if you finally pass a stage.

review:
If you want a game to rage with your friends,this might or might not be the experience youre looking for. If you want to rage collectively failing to clear a hard level, do yourself a favour and keep walking. If however your desired rage lies in a non functional multiplayer which requires you to manually open some port on your router using a program youre supposed to download from a website that might or might not be trustworthy THEN TODAY IS YOUR LUCKY DAY.
Now if you excuse me, i have to be salty somewhere else GOOD DAY TO YOU.

author: {'steamid': '76561198411902146', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2865, 'last_played': 1567373075}
review:
Unbelievably hard. Can't slip up or hesitate, or you die and try again. Music's good, level designs are good, cats are good, and the bloody death animation is cute and gorey. 
Is it a good game? Yes. Would I recommend the game? Absolutely not, unless you're someone who likes to suffer through hundreds of thousands of deaths without hope of succeeding. The level of difficulty is the only thing I don't like about it. I watched friends go insane while playing this. 
However, as I said, it's not a bad game. It's in fact very good. And with friends, it's a whole lot more fun. Hopefully they won't stop being your friend after playing this X3
I'm guessing the sequel is just as frustrating. But knowing myself, I'll probably get the game and play anyways, cause I'm stubborn and always finish what I start. But I'll definitely take a long break before playing that second game. Like at least a few years. Though if you think you actually have what it takes, I won't stop you. I'm just here to warn that it will give you pain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043108500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 767, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1586193339}
review: This game is recommended for people who are really good at platforming. This game will put you in so much frustration, which is probably one of the reasons why people like games like this. Because of the challenge, and if you ever do beaten it or just not so interested in levels that are "too hard" for you, theres workshop with custom levels. Though regardless, any levels will be difficult and can be frustrating to beat. Only get this if you are into challenges, otherwise prepare for many frustrations on your playthrough.

review:
Raising the price all the way to 60 BRL and doing an infinite discount is illegal, i bought this for 3 BRL (0,99 US $).

Anyway, this game is AMAZING! One of the best in this genre.


Edit: I had to open my modem ports so my friends could connect. We played the entire game, TWICE, with no problem and no lag :)

Edit 2: if you're having trouble with port forwarding, try using radmin or hamachi.

review: Bloody Trapland √© um jogo onde voc√™ vai passar MUITA mas MUITA raiva. A n√£o ser que voc√™ j√° esteja acostumado em jogar com seu amigo trolando suas partidas. √â um jogo de plataforma 2d ao estilo dos jogos do Mario, por√©m os levels s√£o lotados de armadilhas, espinhos, teleportadores, armas, blocos trolls e SOFRIMENTO ETERNO. O jogo √© bem simples pelo seu pre√ßo orginal, mas em promo√ß√µes o jogo fica barato o suficiente que voc√™ consegue compra-lo vendendo cartas ou itens de outros jogos. O jogo brilha no multiplayer, sendo poss√≠vel jogar at√© 4 jogadores. √â muito mais divertido voc√™ passar raiva na companhia de alguns amigos. O jogo tem possibilidade de multiplayer por√©m √© bem bugado pra entrar nas salas. S√≥ consegui jogar com meus amigos usando o famoso Hamachi. Aconselho comprarem o 2 que deve ter um suporte para o multiplayer muito melhor e deve ser muito mais "liso" de jogar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452894062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1560976715}
review: This game has decent platforming for the few minutes I played, but for a game that proudly states that it is a multiplayer game, the multiplayer feature is a mess. To even play online with friends, one must install third party software, and even then, the game will still not work most of the time. I would recommend this only for its single player features only, but since it must proudly state its online multiplayer mode, I do not recommend this game overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046034475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1560887084}
review:
A catchy soundtrack, cute characters, and bloody carnage.

A truly fun platforming game. The predecessor of Bloody Trapland 2(obviously), its mechanics are a bit simpler; there's no wall-jumping or jump-dashing... but it's every bit as challenging. It's not for everyone, as there are cheap deaths and some of the challenges are about making pixel-perfect jumps and managing extremely strict timings between obstacles.

You play as one of four cute color-coded furry characters that each serve as a One Hit Point Wonder. Anything that can kill you will kill you in one hit. The traps are brutal and unforgiving, but surprisingly not very punishing; the maps are set up in short gauntlets that are quick to complete, allowing you to finish one area, take a break and come back to the next any time you so desire. You respawn instantly after dying, so there's no wait time before you can re-join the action. Persistence is highly rewarded--as long as you keep pressing forward, little by little, and overcoming each individual challenge, you WILL make progress despite the immense difficulty of the game.

The game is built to be played either single player or multiplayer. However, there are many maps you can ONLY reach if you play multiplayer, as they require you to either use your comrades as cannon fodder or to use them as springboards to reach higher areas. I do personally feel that the game is more fulfilling played in multiplayer; in some ways, having friends play with you makes the game easier as you can help each other get past obstacles you normally wouldn't be able to. In other ways, it's a new challenge, with some previously-harmless areas becoming death traps in which you can only barely avoid springboarding off of your friends' heads and killing them. It's truly genius level design. This makes multiplayer a far more fresh, chaotic, and therefore interesting experience to play through.

It also comes with a custom level designer in case you want to bring the pain your own way. I haven't yet tested it out, but I have high hopes for it.

At the time I've bought it, it was on sale for a mere $1.50. The full price of $10 seems like it would be worthwhile. I absolutely recommend it and hope to see Bloody Trapland 2 on sale soon so that I can afford it, as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198839456080', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1636738054}
review:
out of all the call of duty games to date, this one is by far the best. the mechanics are great and u can play as not one, not two but 4 different coloured cats.  

pros:
-one of the cats holds a bananna 
-the red cat is cool

cons:
-no battle royale
-it isnt Knack 2 

spoiler alert: 
the compelling story has a gut wrenching twist when captain price turns out to be the bad guy all along, u then proceed to maul him with ur cat claws. i thought this was worth mentioning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099016407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1553371742}
review: Bought this game solely to play with few friends, only to discover the multiplayer doesnt work in any capacity. Messed around with the game by myself in an attempt to not feel like I wasted my money, and its actually not a bad game, albeit often rage inducing. Its only receiving a thumbs down from me specifically for the multiplayer connection issues, but if you dont care about that and you hate yourself, this game will probably be a good fit for you.

I'm a bit surprised that i liked it as, in most cases, I don't have much interest in platform games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335100217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1634364593}
review:
Jogo bem desafiador e √≥timo para jogar (e se estressar) com os amigos. Calma. √â aquele estresse saud√°vel. 

T√≠pico game de plataforma que voc√™ morre mil vezes at√© conseguir passar da fase, por√©m √© ABSURDAMENTE divertido e hil√°rio.

Troll no estilo "Cat Mario", cada fase completa √© uma vit√≥ria. 

Com possibilidade de jogar com at√© 4 amigos NO MESMO PC (coisa rara hoje em dia) e no controle, √© uma das melhores pedidas para reunir a galera para uma jogatina divertida. 

At√© quem n√£o est√° muito familiarizado com videogame consegue se dar bem, pois os controles s√°o bem simples: voc√™ s√≥ anda, pula e abaixa.

O √∫nico "problema" do jogo, √© que chega um momento que a dificuldade das fases aumenta tanto, que o jogo fica perto do imposs√≠vel. Voc√™ vai demorar muito para passar de algumas.  

Eu jogava com um amigo e n√£o cheguamos a zerar o jogo. Travamos em uma fase pr√≥ximo do final que era t√£o surreal que achamos melhor desistir. Quem sabe um dia tentamos de novo.

Um ponto positivo, pelo menos, √© que se um dos jogadores chegar ao final da fase, ela ja √© completada. N√£o √© necess√°rio que todos chegem ao final. Ainda bem, pois meu amigo me salvou em diversos momentos que n√£o teria conseguido kkkk

Se voc√™ quer morrer de rir e se estressar um bucado com seus amigos, e √© um bom brasileiro e n√£o desiste nunca, Bloodytrap Land √â A PEDIDA!

J√° vi esse jogo por R$3,00. Super recomendo, ganhei de presente (deste amigo que jogou comigo), mas compraria certamente!

author: {'steamid': '76561198137739583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1549043599}
review:
The overall game was fine but the more you play it the more you realise that a bunch of the levels include RNG. Not only that but most of the obstacles become desynced and you end up dying because it's literally impossible to save yourself. This doesn't happen all that often but a good 10-15% of my deaths were RNG or Desync related.

Another thing I noticed is that there are a few obstacles in multiple stages that added artificial difficulty to the game, meaning - they didn't make it more challenging to beat the stage, they only made it more annoying. Their placement wasn't justified, in my opinion, and served as an anger inducer (Not talking about the orange troll blocks, I liked those.)

If anybody cares about the difficulty - check the playtime I have on the game. This is the amount of time it took me to beat it (minus 30-40 mins from a few years ago when I was messing around with a friend) Bloody Trapland is a casual "I wanna be the guy" which, for me at least, had a sudden difficulty spike at the last world. Fun game nonetheless. Recommend you to buy it when it's discounted. I eat a s s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168089115', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1532213170}
review: You won't find such thing as ''fun'' in this pile of garbage. Such games should stay on the freeware flash sites, yet they even charge money for it. Badly designed levels with a single purpose to cheapshot players, with a horrible collision mechanic. Graphics are just plain horrible, bad as in the bad way.. If you think that this is something among the lines of Super Meat Boy you are very wrong. It's one of those uninspiring, low quality, crap games that got the massive exposure that it doesn't deserve. There is literally nothing to aim for here.. same routine over and over again with no goal, you don't get anything for going further apart steam useless achievements. No story, no humor.. even the gore is lame. If anyone familiar with a Happy Tree Friends, thinks that this game might be in the same spirit like the show? It's.. just bad.. Save your money, I struggle to find at least anything good to say about this junk.

review:
Although I played the game for a short amount of time (as of this review), it is clear that you need friends who own the game in order to enjoy it. None of my friends have it.
However, it is still a good game in my eyes. It's a good platforming challenge for anyone who is up to the task.
But, if you want a solo challenging platformer, just buy MegaMan Legacy Collection, as the games in it are critically aclaimed classic.
7.5/10 ign

author: {'steamid': '76561198059498867', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1534810928}
review:
Salt, table salt or common salt is a mineral composed primarily of sodium chloride (NaCl), a chemical compound belonging to the larger class of salts; salt in its natural form as a crystalline mineral is known as rock salt or halite. Salt is present in vast quantities in seawater, where it is the main mineral constituent. The open ocean has about 35 grams (1.2 oz) of solids per litre, a salinity of 3.5%.

Salt is essential for life in general, and saltiness is one of the basic human tastes. Salt is one of the oldest and most ubiquitous food seasonings, and salting is an important method of food preservation.

Some of the earliest evidence of salt processing dates to around 8,000 years ago, when people living in the area of present-day Romania boiled spring water to extract salts; a salt-works in China dates to approximately the same period. Salt was also prized by the ancient Hebrews, the Greeks, the Romans, the Byzantines, the Hittites, Egyptians, and the Indians. Salt became an important article of trade and was transported by boat across the Mediterranean Sea, along specially built salt roads, and across the Sahara on camel caravans. The scarcity and universal need for salt have led nations to go to war over it and use it to raise tax revenues. Salt is used in religious ceremonies and has other cultural and traditional significance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103432444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1704041014}
review: One of the best game I've ever played and I'm for real. I first saw it from a Hungarian Youtuber duo, me and my friend liked them playing this so much so we decided to play it at my friend since he had it from a gift. We played it through for the 1st time after days of trying, including all of the hidden stages, he said he was having fun but 1 playthrough was enough for him. I continued playing and mastering it I have many many hours in this game by now. I'm World 6th in the Adventure rank list and World 1st on some of the race levels. I can only recommend this game for anyone who is looking for a challenging but rewarding and fun game. Definitly buying Bloody Trapland 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059971262', 'num_games_owned': 2458, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1522313984}
review:
Bloody Trapland is a really, really hard platformer. The game is mostly thought to be played in co-op (1-4) but it is still quite fun solo.

Compared to a lot of other games that consider themselves as "hardcore platformer", this one doesn't feel like most who are unfair. Maybe 1-2 traps in the whole game (!!) could be considered unfair, but you'll never feel like quitting just because you couldn't see a trap.

... At least, that wouldn't be the reason for you to quit the game.

it does seem like a very fun game ive watched people play on youtube before i purchased but i couldnt figure out nor my 3 friends how to connect to an online lobby. i sent a refund in and they gave me back both copies i purchased within 2 days of submiting. like i said look like a really fun game just need to figure out some multiplayer isues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021004801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1517907195}
review:
As a fan of platformers I do not reccomend this game. The one thing it offers, being a difficult/silly game to play with friends is done better elsewhere and what is left is a very basic game. There is no real story, no characterization, no humor and a lack of variety in the obstacles you face. 

The game features 4 playable cat sprites and 3 game modes one of which is playable alone. For mechanics you can jump at one of two heights, move, crouch and use other players as springboards to jump higher. There is no interesting or compelling aesthetic, no compelling gameplay and when playing alone it feels like a shell of a game. You jump through uninteresting levels featuring uninteresting traps and while there is an incredible ammount of content avaliable through custom levels there is nothing that makes this game special. Yes the game is very challenging but there is no satisfaction to be had. Playing for a single hour sucked the life from me when I typically adore platformers. The platforming itself did not feel good and the game brought nothing new to the table that many other games dont do better.

You may enjoy this game more if you are playing with friends, but you have better options in Battleblock Theatre, Ultimate Chicken Horse or nearly any other co-op platformer. If you want a platformer to play alone go play N+, I Wanna Be The Boshy or Cave Story. I was gifted the game so I cant say it wasnt worth the money, but it certainly wasn't worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068953887', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1547591426}
review:
I loved playing this game and going through each painful level but each time you completed a hard level, part, task or object within the worlds or levels it makes you sigh in relief like never before. The thrill of getting far in a near impossible level and then dying really makes this game worth completing just because it feels like a life achievment on its own.

Multiplayer is the only bad thing about this game so far within my experience, it is near impossible to host or join a "quick play" server but luckily using hamachi and sharing a ip was quite easy and made the experience more enjoyable with my friend [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/DingDong69420/] Jack [/url] who i gifted the game too.

I am very satisfied with the game <3

review: This is possibly this best game ever made! Me and my friends tried to play on an online server hosted by me and it didn't work. Then my friend tried to host and it didnt work, same with the other friend.  I then proceeded to play by myself and I acended into videogame nirvana.  The gameplay is orgasmic, the graphics are incredibly advanced, and the whole experience added so much to my life.  Thank you 2Play for this amazing game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035538261', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1579743737}
review:
I get mad at hard games but I keep it cool sometimes. When it comes to games that I'm looking for that has great soundtrack, Has multiplayer, and loads of challenging yet fun levels.. This game came to me. Since I saw YTbers played this game, I had this game on my wishlist. I love the graphics and the levels. If anyone has the money to find a good challenging, fun, Multiplayer, or platformer game, Try this game. There's a sequal out on Early Access (that's in the works rn, i'll edit this review when the sequal's out.) so if you love the 1st, You'll love the sequal. 

Overall, I give this game a 10/10 for everything of the best game I've ever played. 

-Nikolai. (NS)

P.S: this game is hard, but not Cuphead kind of hard. It's actually challenging and difficult, but is still fun. (like I said.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198095436502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1508106445}
review:
In a quest for new multiplayer games, Bloody Trapland was a perfect match.
The only downfall about it's Online Multiplayer mode is having to Port Forward/Hamachi, but once that was situated with this game was an absolute blast with pals.

You're fooled at the beginning into thinking this game was going to be a joyride with occassional hardships, but boy was everyone wrong. This game gets insanely difficult the further you go along, [b]especially[/b] the 4th world. You really aren't going to get the full experience of this game if you play alone, playing with friends is necessary in order to ensure you have others to rage along with you instead of doing it alone.
