author: {'steamid': '76561198116894021', 'num_games_owned': 1715, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1608497605}
review:
It's like a big Final Fantasy Boss!

I can't decide if it's fun or frustrating :D
This game will prove how good your friendship with your friends really is. It's like a love/hate relationship :D

Pro:
- Challanging
- Some levels are really hard
- You can learn to master it, but it takes a while
- Good Game to play with good friends
- Must have for every couch gaming session
- Final Fantasy Boss Music

Con
- Your living room can get really loud and you have to calm down your swearing friends
- After trying one level for about 30 minutes it can get frustrating
- more than 2 player will only make the game worse to play because everyone will kill each other. It's easiest in 1 player mode.

Still a really enjoyable game :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198047726667', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1507778498}
review:
Was pleasantly surprised by the game; friends recommended it to me because it was on sale (~$1.50).

It's a blast to play with friends; had a great time messing with them, dying hilariously, and beating insanely difficult levels. The game is easy to pick up--I was able to keep up with my friends in about half an hour, I'd say--but extremely hard to master. A lot of the levels are insanely difficult, usually requiring an unreasonable amount of frame-perfect inputs, deceiving you with fake portals that take you back to the start (from what time I've played as of writing this--about 3 hours--they were all easily predictable that they would do this to you, so you can avoid them), and the levels in general being very long.

This being said, it's what I expected going into it, so I wasn't annoyed by the difficulty or some of the outrageous obstacles in some levels. Likewise, the satisfaction of actually beating a level is extremely high.

I recommend the game, but maybe only if it's on sale. Depends on your tastes and how easily you get mad. Controller is recommended, of course.

review: Super lustiges Spiel welches allerdings auch Nerven erfodert. Es macht eine Menge Spa√ü durch die verschiedenen Level zu springen ohne zu sterben und lustig wird es wenn man sieht wie oft man gestorben ist und das ganze Level gef√ºhlt Rot gef√§rbt ist vom eigenen Blut. Das Spiel w√ºrde ich euch im Multiplayer empfehlen das es definitiv viel mehr Spa√ü und Laune bereitet als alleine (vorallem wenn man nicht immer als Team spielt und versucht sich zu Supporten ;) ). Das Spiel wird mit jedem weiterem Level schwerer und schwerer was gut ist das man es nicht einfach so mal durch spielt und und halt auhc etwas Geduld und k√∂nnen fordert. Dennoch Wer diese Zeit und vorallem die Geduld hat sollte im Stande sein jedes Level zu schaffen. Von Daher mit hat es eine Menge Spa√ü gemacht es mit Freunden durchzuspielen und ich habe es nicht bereut es mir mit ihnen gekauft zu haben.

review:
Oh, its an adventure game alright. An adventure to kill all the brain cells in your head!
The challenge is real.
The anger is real.
The salt is real.
The rage quit is real.

This game will want you to put yourself into the electric chair.
I will recommend this game to ONLY the challenge seekers. 

You bored? Have any friends?
Yeah, don't even think of playing this game. I just saved you.

Tip: There is no rushing. Just patience.

review: I haven't dished out many hours on this but the sole reason for that is because ITS REALLY DIFFICULT. The game's main premise is to go through a multitude of levels like a Super mario game while countless traps try to kill you. It's extremely fun with friends but i would wait until it goes on sale to buy it. For it's normal price i wouldn't say its worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039618459', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1660426243}
review:
it isn't murder if you just ask someone to play a game with you (who then proceeds to lose his will to live)

10/10 play this game with people you want not to enjoy their lives anymore (this obviously includes any friends you might have (or have had after you got them to play this game with you))



regarding the game itself: it's actually quite fun (i personally love it) if you enjoy challenges, the game wants you to lose your hope of beating it, the game wants to beat you in any possible way you can imagine (i can imagine it would try to beat you up if you'd ever meet it in some dark corner), so if you enjoy a challenge like this have fun to show that you're the one beating the game and not vice versa.

sadly i wanted to play this game with at least one friend but everyone i've ever played it with ended up not wanting to continue, so i haven't completed the game myself (and i'd also recommend against playing alone and if you ask me i'd tell you to always play it with friends as i believe there are some places you can't reach alone) not vice versa.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995348267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1480051130}
review: This game is really damn hard.  I wouldn't say its as hard as some of the sections in I Want To Be The Guy or Boshi or anything quite like that, but its hard as nails.  It's also one of the best co-op games on Steam bar none.  It's an experience best 'enjoyed' with another person and the amount of frustration adds up to a lot of hilarity and the eventual release of success is a huge payoff that you really do all feel together.  Really something.  A sequel came out recently, that looks fantastic as well, but even if you did play that, this game is still worth coming back to.

review:
DId you ever wish super meatboy had multiplayer?

This is as close to that as you can get perhaps for netplay anyways. Speaking of which the netplay works pretty good. Finally one of these types of games that isn't just local multiplayer!

This game will have all players laughing histerically at the carnage. And loud shouting upon a hard fought victory and glory as you are the one to solve the level finally!

This is the perfect game for a party night, but not as fun for a single player. Highly recommended.

My Friend: Nah you do the rest of this cmon
Me: Runs over to where he is flawlessly 
My Friend: Alright lets go
Me: Wait one second
*Jumps on his head* 
*Purposly kills myself*
That level took us an hour and a half to get through 10/10 would lose friends again

author: {'steamid': '76561198062641181', 'num_games_owned': 1123, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1679095376}
review:
Bloody trapland is a hard platformer.

[h1]Summary[/h1]
There are 3 gamemodes;
In [b]Deathmatch[/b] you try to kill eachother by jumping on eachothers head.
In [b]Adventure[/b], which is the main gamemode you go over a bunch of obstacles to reach the end.
[b]Race[/b] is like Adventure but then you race towards the end, trying to kill eachother on the way.

[h1]Pro's[/h1]
[list][*]A real challenge
[*]Good controls
[*]Satisfying when you finish a level
[*][url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/257750/workshop/]Workshop[/url]
[/list]
[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list][*]You probably will get stuck on a level, only 2% finished the game
[*]Lava projectiles are random and is frustrating when you get killed by them
[*]A lot of people rage with this game
[/list]

[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=842384677][i]Everything is more fun with friends but it has some downsides[/i][/url];

[h1]Online[/h1]
[list]
[*]When done finished a level while playing with friends and he wants to complete the level you'll need to wait on him to finish it which can take quite a while.
[*]Your friends can kill you in Adventure mode, instead of stacking, making you wait for your friends.
[/list]

I really enjoy this game, it gives a challenge and overcoming that challenge is [u]awesome[/u]!
Online mode could be a lot better though. Instead of killing your friends when you jump on their head, it would pace the game up greatly if you could just stack on eachother instead. Also when the level is done instead of going to the next level, it could be more fun for the other players to let the other players finish the level and meanwhile give the player who already made it something to do.

I would recommend this game if you like a challenge.

[url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Multiplayer_Game_Reviews#curation]Click here to check out all my multiplayer game reviews.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198001046455', 'num_games_owned': 13132, 'num_reviews': 349, 'playtime_forever': 1220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1626723786}
review:
[b]Briefly: [i]Bloody Trapland[/i] is a precision platformer of distinct levels. Alright game, yet some game design choices are rage-inducing in a mixed way.[/b]

I bought this to a group of friends a couple of years ago to play together. We played it a couple of times (a few hours) and had fun trying to beat "the story missions". I forgot about it for a long time before coming back on a couple of occasions to beat the rest of the levels by myself. I consider it one of the hardest platformers I've played.

[i]Bloody Trapland[/i] is perfectly described by its name. It's a precision platformer where a tiny mistake means death and you may die hundreds of times before beating a level. The traps are everywhere and deaths paint the levels red (unless you turn off the gore). Adding some chaos, you can play it co-operatively or competitively with your friends.

[h1]Action multiplayer madness[/h1]

Played multiplayer, like it's probably meant, [i]Bloody Trapland[/i] is good fun for a while. The bipedal cat furry humanoids run through the obstacle course that is the trapland and try to reach the door to the next area without dying. Jumping on a fellow furry kills them in a bloody pop, similar to the obscure multiplayer deathmatch [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jump_'n_Bump][i]Jump 'n Bump[/i][/url].

There's also a deathmatch and race modes with their own levels. To perfect the game, a par time has to be reached in the race levels that may benefit from or even require playing co-operatively.

Level design is nice, levels are fairly complex or sometimes there are two alternate routes to the end. The story mode also has several routes through it, some requiring co-op to beat.

It's too bad controls cannot be changed, and only one local player may play on keyboard with arrows. Up to four players may play with controllers though (I've tested and played it with Xbox controllers).

[h1]Embrace the respawn[/h1]

Name fits the game very well: Levels are filled with traps. Sharp traps, squishing traps, and surprise traps. Bottomless holes, guns, aiming cannons and bouncing fireballs. There are the classic spikes and sawblades, both moving and retracting ones and they come in several sizes. Occasional teleporter makes it initially impossible to tell how the level should be played out.

Fundamentally, the traps are of four types: stationary, moving, periodic and reacting ones. The moving ones [i]usually[/i] have a distinct pattern of some kind (however see below). Periodic ones [i]usually[/i] go off at set intervals (again, see below). 

Reacting ones are mostly fine: there's a gun, it's going to shoot when you go in front of it, and there are falling blocks that go when you step under them and get squished. These are all fine if initially surprising.

However, [i]Bloody Trapland[/i] hosts two kinds of traps that I absolutely abhorred:
[list]
[*] Hidden falling blocks
[*] Jumping lava balls
[/list]
The hidden blocks are literally inside the wall, impossible to see before they first strike. The jumping lava balls bounce from the lava at quasi-periodic intervals at various different heights, impossible to anticipate.

Both of the above traps can be kind of fun when playing with friends. When playing solo, they become extremely frustrating. The blocks because they artificially prolong the levels before you know to even try to avoid them, fire balls because they cause totally random deaths. You can pull a perfect speed run (required in the race modes for gold status), taken away from you at the very end through sheer chance by a fire ball that jumps at the same time as you, it's rage-inducing.

[h1]Conclusions[/h1]

I spent 19 hours with [i]Bloody Trapland[/i] before beating every level. That includes about 5 hours of co-op play with friends. Hardest levels/challenges were likely those that required co-op play because of the inherent requirement of coordination.

I am left with mixed feelings of the game. With friends it was quite fun, and many levels were pretty fun even in solo play. But some of the lame traps made solo play incredibly frustrating and that utterly ruined some levels for me.

So if you can live with that and/or you and your friends are up for Nintendo-hard platforming, [i]Bloody Trapland[/i] might be an alright investment. And if you really dig it, there's a level editor and so an infinite amount of custom content, if the extremely challenging original levels are not enough. Still, because of the above qualms, I'd wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041706486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1473886303}
review:
It is a tipical contept of "easy to learn hard to master". If you ever played the original super mario game you already know the game mechanics. The only minor differences are in this game there are neither mushrooms nor coins to collect. Although these are replaced with creative homicidal traps around the map. Now if you ever see a game with "multiplayer or Coop" tags you immediately think oh this is a fun game to play with friends. You guessed wrong. Playing over 1 hour with my degenerate "friends" was enough to realise Super mario's bloopers or hammer brothers are kind and cuddly. 
You don't play this game because it is fun or entertanining. It is the complete opposite of it. 

5/7 would recommend as an official e-sports game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097301293', 'num_games_owned': 783, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1599181921}
review:
the game is fun and challanging, i love the colors and the art style they went with.... but dont let it fool you, this game.... this game is so hard at times that you get pissed, plus your so called friend jump on you for fun and smear you entrails all over the map. sure the game is simple: get to the end of the level and continue on to the next but when you cant make it past the first 10 steps doo to your frienemys jumping on you because they suck at it, just increases said rage till you hate them, the game , your family, your dog, youself, your shoes, everything. but then the rage is finily released upon compleation of another level only to repeat the prosses again.
i know it sounds like im bashing the game but its fun and full of laughs and memories to be had, but this game will get under your skin. i dont suggest trying to pull an all nighter on this game for i think you might very well end someone or somethings life from pure anger. 
10/10 would rage again

review: A nice, easy platformer game. Until you realise everything is made to kill you in the most frustrating ways imaginable. And then once you master the super hard, almost impossible levels, the easy stuff comes back to bite you when you forget how to jump over a gap and die right before the end of the level. Fun and rewarding, but only for about 5 minutes at a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058347228', 'num_games_owned': 1167, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1480008038}
review:
Well, it was fun the one time I got to play it, unfortunately the developers neglected to add a resolution option, something that is very basic when it comes to games. Instead the game now launches in a random resolution with no way of changing it leaving me with a tiny box to play in or a horrendous stretched fullscreen, basically I can no longer play the game. 

I've tried everything I can think of and could not find a file anywhere that would allow me to edit this manually. Even turning off my secondary monitors and restarting, none of it helped it just wasted my time.

Be careful buying this, you could end up with something that is not playable, or certainly not enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129787527', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1500979466}
review:
This game is as frustrating to play as it looks. This very simple platformer is not worth what you pay for it honestly. It is fun to play with friends with the race and deathmatch modes it offers. To play this game by yourself will require patience and some self control. This game is very unforgiving compared to some other platformers I have played, however you do still get a great sense of achievement when you do manage to get past some of these levels. The controls are very sharp, and to get past some obstacles in this cute yet gory platformer, it requires much precision, timing and some rhythm at times. I would reccomend playing this game with music or a podcast if you are desperate to complete this game, as it will take time. Many parts of each level are cruel and hard on the player, prepare to have a bad time.

Overall do not get this game if you:
[list]
       [*] Are bad at platformers
       [*] Are easily enraged
       [*] Have enough money to buy something better for the same price.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198049196395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1590214447}
review:
This is another game that there should really be a neutral button. It's not a bad game although it's not the best either. The soundtrack is really amazing. It sounds like something that would fit in an old school Mega Man game. However there are only a couple of tracks. Online play is just awful, the community is dead on arrival. The only way to play online with friends is if you host the game. It doesn't have Steamworks so it's a pain in the ass to set up if you don't know how to host a game. Luckily you also have the option of local multiplayer up to 4 people. The gameplay is ok, it's one of those games like They Bleed Pixels or Super Meat Boy style games where one hit instantly kills you. It's boring by yourself but with friends it's loads of fun. It's an ok game. I can only recommend this game if you have friends willing to play. Another thing is this game for $10 is asking too much. Get it while it's on sale. Otherwise I give it a pass. 5/10

Please note, don't use Hamachi! It's a real pain in the ass and is loaded with adware/malware. To host the game online just type in your IP address on your browser. The port number for this game is 6883.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1952, 'num_reviews': 2041, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1473270189}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

Bloody Trapland is a game developed by 2Play.se, the game is simple yet offer a very challenging campaign. The multiplayer is utilised well however you can't get into secret levels unless you co-operate with teammates

Oh and by the way there are secret levels!

The gameplay is very fluid and nothing really strange happens under normal conditions. The game offers very nice graphics and the in-game music is good and almost zero random events which kill you like in most platformers...

However, the multiplayer offered can be very glitchy when the ping between you and the player is higher than 100ms such as bullets curving from their paths rather than being delayed...

However, Bloody Trapland is a fun yet challenging to game alone or even better with your friends!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]
[i] Also, best to play with a controller [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198010134705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1473136680}
review:
Controls are decent.  
The levels are tricky but that's the point.  
The levels are relatively short, which works for them.
The music, while not bad, gets repeditive immediately.  Standard for games like this.
The level editor does not seem to work very well.  Locks up very fast.
The downloadable comunity levels do not seem to exist.  This may be part of the last point.

I would say do not buy this unless it is on a really good sale.  
The $1.99 I paid seems right, if a bit steep.  This game seems like it wants to be a cutesy version of N+.  It has most of the parts neccessary.  But just seems to not come together well.  I wish I could be more specific than that.  But I can't.

Bloody Trapland hat mir sehr viel Spa√ü bereitet aber auch Hass. Hunderte Tode ben√∂tigte man um schlie√ülich zum Ausgang in sp√§teren Leveln zu kommen, das kostet Nerven. Trotzdem ist das Spiel sehr schick, abwechslungsreich, bockschwer(aber wirklich bockschwer!!!) und spa√üig im Koop. Ein Workshop sorgt zudem auch nach der Kampagne f√ºr mehr abwechslung oder aber man spielt andere Modi wie z.B. Race gegen seine Freunde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133602971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1479944705}
review:
Bloody Trapland is a fun, hardcore based platformer that puts the player through challenging levels such as Mario.

The game includes a story mode, along with an option to play maps created by users in the workshop (All Free!) 

Think of it like Super Mario Maker but with a bloody twist. The game also offers easy servers to create so you can play with others around the world. I experienced some difficulties but for the most part it worked fine. (I suggest using Hamachi)

Overall, I had fun playing this game. The challenging levels had me excited and thrilled when completed but with the difficulty increasing over time, I unfortunately lost interest very fast.

I highly suggest buying this game with your friends, it makes the game more fun, and enjoyable.

7/10 (Great)

author: {'steamid': '76561198119224164', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1521657880}
review:
Rage Quit Simulator 2016

This game has more blood than an average Tarantino movie, and can f*ck your mind up easily. Levels are sometimes so hard that you will just get tired and stop playing. But if you convince a few friends to play together, this game is actually fun. Mostly because you can kill your friends prevent them from complete the level. The menu is a bit messy, for me finding how to play multiplayer was a pain, joining through Steam doesn't work. Overall it's a nice game, if you see it on discount it's definetely worths to buy, but don't play it alone.

Get a 4-pack, it's super fun with 4 players, especially offline.

Common phrases while playing:

DUDE, STOP, OMG, F***, S***, OH C'MON, NUUUU, SO CLOSE, REALLY, GDI (insert name here), YES, ACK, UGH

3 modes:

Adventure - Still ends up being competitive, but at some point collaboration (whether intentional or not) really goes a long way in completing the level

Race - Great with sabotaging others. We would go from being super competitive, to somewhat cooperative when we were desperate to completing the level, then back to competitive again

Deathmatch - Get the high ground

You play as one of four cats, with 9...thousand lives (infinite lives really). YouTube vids do not fully encapsulate how fun this game really is. Great for casual parties. 

Many steam games are for sale for less than $3, and are still not worth it. This is worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079620489', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1463774726}
review:
Rage Quit Simulator 2016

This game has more blood than an average Tarantino movie, and can f*ck your mind up easily. Levels are sometimes so hard that you will just get tired and stop playing. But if you convince a few friends to play together, this game is actually fun. Mostly because you can kill your friends prevent them from complete the level. The menu is a bit messy, for me finding how to play multiplayer was a pain, joining through Steam doesn't work. Overall it's a nice game, if you see it on discount it's definetely worths to buy, but don't play it alone.

review:
Die 50 time on a level, but finally you reach the last trap, you try to jump over it, but you dies. You RAGE quit.
On the next day you try again, and after 20 dies you complete the level.
That goddamm feeling :D :D!
Its a game about NOT GIVING UP, and the hope that I CAN DO THIS! Very motivational game indeed.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198224638656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1459612366}
review: If you like challenging rage games to play with your friends then this is the game for you! I personally didn't get too rage-y, but that's only because I have lots of patience, which you will very much need. Patentice, concentration, and control to not throw your computer across the room. The levels were challenging, but in a good way, even the beginning ones, which if you want a challenge then this is your game. Teamwork is not always key to the game, since you can beat levels on your own, but playing with others defiantly helps when one of them can be bait.

There are some people having problem hosting online game in Bloody Trapland, so here is a quick guide of how to do it.

To be able to host online games in Bloody Trapland, you will need to open/forward port 6883 if your behind a firewall/router.
How you do this varies deepening on your OS/Router/Firewall.
Verify if your port is open here: Canyouseeme.org

Portforward Guides: http://portforward.com/help/start_here.htm

If you for some reason is not able to open/forward this port, you may use hamachi to host a game instead. 

Enjoy game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040861116', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1600563162}
review:
Hard little game, but still fun. I wouldn't pay full price for it, but the sale price was hard to pass.

Playing with friends makes this a little more difficult. You go through the first 3 worlds against each other, always killing the other to try and get ahead, once you get to the 6th world, you often times wait your turn so you don't screw the other player up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042250405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1497990688}
review: Buckle up your seatbelts kids, cause you're in for the most adrenaline filled thrill ride of your life. This journey, this quest, spurs  from the darkest depths of your imagination as you gear up for this damn gruesome as hell nightmare of a game known as Bloody Trapland. You are a cat, on his journey home however it is actual AIDs and will make you consider suicide at least 10 times whilst you get absolutely rekt. Is fun, would die to spikes, lasers, fists, spikes, spring traps, bullets, gravity and other cats again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010786164', 'num_games_owned': 756, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1454843139}
review:
The game could benefit from having better level design and jumps less pixel perfect. 



It's not about git gud, it's about how autistic you are. Game isn't challenging due to player skill, it's challenging due to every jump inexplicably needing to be perfect, so if you have a week to play, you'll eventually beat it. Not because you're progressing in gaining mastery, but because you made four perfect jumps in a row.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258611338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1462223207}
review:
If you feel like you've been having a much too pleasent week, hop on this game and let the addiction slowly drive you into inevitable insanity. 
On a serious note, it's extremely addictive and is great to pass time. Was worth picking up, as it was on sale.
It is NOT, however, worth the money, if it's NOT on sale. Why?
Well, for one the multiplayer system is extremely flawed. To connect to a friend without getting connection errors one must either port forward or use hamachi, which for a steam game just isn't acceptable. And even then, there are constant time outs and if you're playing with three or more players one or two of them WILL lag out and spazz around the map, which is extremely disorienting and just plain annoying. Playing alone just isn't fun. So connecting these two points makes for a kind of mediocre game. Were they to fix the connection issues, however, then the game would be 100x more amazing and I'd definetely play and record some of this for my channel.
I'd give it a 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047276573', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1690401810}
review:
Firstly, I love this game because you can drive all over Europe. You have to manage your money, and make sure that, when you get out a loan from the bank, you have enough money to pay it back, or are at least making enough daily profit to pay it back.

You also manage a business. You can hire drivers to work for you, and they will complete jobs for you, but you have to pay them a wage, plus some for every journey they complete. You level up they skills, that make them be better at certian things, like you can make them earn more money for going over a set distance, or you can make them carry high value or fragile cargo. They can also carry ADR materials, so things that could be dangourous. But you get paid more for that.

You can always do 'Quick Jobs', and these are when the employer provides the truck, and you just go where they tell you. This is fun, but it starts to get boring, only doing short deliverys, so you can buy a truck, so that you can go further distances, and get more money.

To conclude, I feel that anybody who likes games like Farm Simulator, or any simulator game should give this game a try, because it is a great way to unwind after a long day, and I have found it to be so much fun and very calming. Some people say that this is a boring game, I happen to disagree.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153511773', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1491541220}

author: {'steamid': '76561198094270178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1440362523}
review:
We all know Bloody Trapland as a popular rage multiplayer game.
Now, considering this is a 'multiplayer' game, I believe the servers should've been fixed a while ago.
It's impossible to join in your friend's game without owning third party applications (such as Hamachi), which I had to install to play this; and even if you do join in, you'll probably be constantly disconnecting.

You can get this to play on your own -- and I only recommend it as a boredom and time killer, not as a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262984108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1554586604}
review:
[b]WARNING:[/b] THIS GAME HAS NO DEDICATED SERVERS. If you're looking to play with friends over Wi-Fi. You have to have a really good internet connection with the time to port forward. Unless you meet the above requirements and have alot of time for setup, you're basically shit out of luck.

The game itself is OKAY. It's certainly no Super Meat Boy, with deaths and level designs progressively feeling like it's not your fault for the cheap death the game decides to throw at you. Some mechanics like the abillity to jump in mid-air if you drop are suprisingly refreshing, but that's about as much "innovation" you'll see in this game.

If you're looking to play solo, buy this game at a discount. If you wanna play with friends over Wi-Fi and have no time to learn and spend on setting up servers, stay away from it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064649288', 'num_games_owned': 767, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1207, 'last_played': 1460206792}
review:
Bloody Trapland der Hardcore Platformer von 2play.
Viele loben das Spiel wegen dem sehr hohen Schwierigkeitsgrad und den unvorhersehbaren Fallen. 
Besonders mit Freunden soll das Spiel sehr interessant sein und f√ºr einen lustigen Abend sorgen.
Das mag vielleicht sein, jedoch sind diese reviews meistens von Nutzern die dem Spiel noch nicht einmal 2 Stunden Spielzeit geschenkt haben und wahrscheinlich auch nicht √ºber die 2. Welt hinausgekommen sind.
Sie sehen das komplette Spiel als eine Art gag an, f√ºr die man auch noch 10‚Ç¨ zahlen muss.
Wer einfach nur nach einem Trial Error Jump n' run sucht wird mit Sicherheit auch auf irgendwelchen Spieleportalen f√ºndig sein mit dem man genau so gut einen lustigen Abend mit seinen Freunden verbringen kann ohne 10‚Ç¨ zahlen zu m√ºssen.
Doch was ist, wenn man wirklich vor hat Bloody Trapland durchzuspielen? und es nicht einfach nur f√ºr eine Stunde Spielzeit kauft? Ganz einfach, man bekommt ein ziemlich schlechtes Jump n' run geliefert.

Zu aller erst m√∂chte ich auf den Multiplayer des Spiels eingehen. Da viele das Spiel kaufen um es mit ein paar Freunden zu spielen. Und der Multiplayer wurde wirklich extrem verhunzt. 
Es kommt durchgehend zu Verbindungsabbr√ºchen oder das beitreten ist noch nicht einmal m√∂glich. 
Hat man dann endlich eine laufende Lobby erstellt, geht es schon weiter mit den Problemen. Denn der beitretende Spieler hat einen klaren Vorteil gegen√ºber dem Leiter der Lobby. Und zwar werden Fallen oder andere Objekte sehr leicht zeitverz√∂gert f√ºr diesen Spieler ausgel√∂st. Der Grund: starke laggs! Und nein es liegt nicht an der Internetverbindung sondern am Spiel selber. Besonders ausnutzen kann man das ganze bei der Steinfalle (Bei der Falle kommt ein Stein aus dem Boden sobald man auf der Fl√§che steht). Normalerweise kann man den Angriff nicht √ºberleben sobald man mittig auf dieser Platte steht, sprich: man m√ºsste solche Fallen auswendig lernen und danach √ºberspringen ohne dass die Falle aktiviert wird. Jedoch nicht f√ºr den beitretenden Spieler. Dieser muss einfach nur dar√ºber rennen und es passiert nichts f√ºr ihn.
Auch kommt es vor dass ein Spieler in das n√§chste Level geworfen wird, der andere aber noch im letzten Level bleibt. So h√ºpft der zweite Spieler noch im Level des ersten herum.
Sogar im Zeitmodus gibt es Fehler, und zwar kommt man des √∂fteren auf eine Abschlusszeit von gerade einmal einer Sekunde weil sein Mitspieler das Ziel erreicht hat. Dadurch werden die eigenen Statistiken und auch die globalen Statistiken komplett verf√§lscht. Werbung f√ºr ein Online Scoreboard zu machen ist dementsprechend einfach nur l√§cherlich.
Insgesamt gravierende Spielfehler die nach all den Jahren nicht gepatcht wurden und auch nicht mehr werden.
Sehr schwache Arbeit von der Seite des Entwicklers.

[i]Jetzt kommen noch 2 Screenshots wo man ein paar weitere Spielfehler sieht.[/i]

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=586965365
Hier stehe ich auf dem Hintergrund / bzw. seitlich an der Wand

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=586965319
und hier bin ich in einem Eisblock gefangen.

Nun, dann spielt man es eben alleine im Singleplayer? Nicht wirklich empfehlenswert da das Spiel in keinster Weise motivierend ist. Andere Spiele die ein solches Trial Error Prinzip aufweisen haben eine sehr gut funktionierende Spieldynamik und eine gute Lernkurve pro Level. Jedoch nicht Bloody Trapland, das Spiel ist alleine nur darauf ausgelegt extrem unfair zu sein, und die Entwickler meinen so ein gutes Spiel zu erschaffen dass sich weit von der Masse abhebt. Und zu meiner Verwunderung: Es kommt auch noch tats√§chlich gut an. Einfach weil so gut wie keiner die Motivation hat das Spiel durchzuspielen oder weil sie sich von dem YouTube Hype leiten lassen.
Es gibt genug schwere Spiele die jedoch ebenso eine Lernkurve aufweisen, eine gute Dynamik besitzen und schlussendlich Spa√ü machen. Und das ist das wichtigste in einem Videospiel.
Die besten Beispiele w√§ren Super Meat Boy oder Dark Souls.
Bloody Trapland hat aber nichts davon. Nicht einmal in punkto Leveldesign kann das Spiel √ºberzeugen, da man hier eine absolut lieblose Welt aufgetischt bekommt mit einem Soundtrack der nach maximal einer Stunde ausgestellt wird.

Spart euch zudem eure "Du magst das Spiel doch nur nicht, weil du zu schlecht bist" Kommentare.
Ich habe das komplette Spiel durchgespielt, alle Secrets gefunden und jeden Stern im Race Modus erlangt.
Gemacht habe ich das nur wegen den Errungenschaften...und ich bereue es.

review:
Wer dachte das Bloody Trapland wirklich spa√ü macht, liegt falsch, denn das Spiel ist ein Rage Game.

Bloody Trapland ist ein feines Spiel f√ºr Zwischendurch das man Solo, Lokal-Koop was durchaus sehr viel spa√ü macht oder Online spielen kann.
Mit 100+ Leveln ist das Spiel nicht schnell durchgezockt vor allem durch den schweren Levelaufbau bei dem man (Wenn man schlecht ist) 100+ mal stirbt was aber einen dazu treibt es endlich schaffen zu wollen und nachdem man es geschafft hat Gl√ºckstr√§nen str√∂men (√úbertrieben gesagt).

Wenn einem die 100+ Level nicht gen√ºgen kann sichmit demLevel Editor befriedigen oder Level aus dem Workshop ziehen.

Die Grafik ... Ja, seht euch die Pics an, es ist eine Pixelgrafik was aber nicht st√∂rt und auch zum Spiel passt.

Fazit: Mit 10‚Ç¨ ist der Preis f√ºr dieses Spiel gerecht ausgew√§hlt den an Spa√ü und Langzeitmotivation fehlt es hier nicht. Grafik ist nat√ºrlich Pixelgrafik aber wer guckt den schon auf sowas und verpasst tolle Spiele?

author: {'steamid': '76561198048542564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1450899954}
review:
The vagina is a muscular and tubular part of the female genital tract, which in humans extends from the vulva to the uterus. The outer vaginal opening may be partly covered by a membrane called the hymen. At the deep end, the cervix (neck of the uterus) bulges into the vagina. The vagina allows for sexual intercourse and childbirth, and channels menstrual flow, which occurs periodically as part of the menstrual cycle.

The location and structure of the vagina varies among species, and may vary in size within the same species. Unlike mammalian males, who usually have the external urethral opening as the only opening for urination and reproduction, mammalian females usually have the urethral opening for urination and the vaginal opening for the genital tract. The vaginal opening is much larger than the nearby urethral opening, and both are protected by the labia in humans. In amphibians, birds, reptiles and monotremes, the cloaca is the single external opening for the gastrointestinal tract and the urinary and reproductive tracts.

While the vagina plays a significant role in human and non-human sexuality, its role with regard to human female sexuality (including heterosexual and lesbian sexual activity) is especially documented. Less is known about the vagina of other animals. In human females and a number of other female mammals, vaginal moisture is increased during sexual arousal by vaginal lubrication, which reduces friction and allows for smoother penetration of the vagina during sexual activity. The texture of the vaginal walls create friction for the penis during sexual intercourse and stimulate it toward ejaculation, enabling fertilization. In addition, a variety of sexually transmitted infections (STIs) and other disorders can affect the vagina. Because of the risk of STIs, safe sex practices are recommended.

Cultural perceptions of the vagina have persisted throughout history, ranging from viewing the vagina as the focus of sexual desire, a metaphor for life via birth, inferior to the penis, or as visually unappealing or otherwise vulgar. In common speech, the word vagina is often incorrectly used to refer to the vulva.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991976358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1429321235}
review:
When you first get this game, you won't be able to get it to work with your friends. You will spend forever trying to figure it out. Then when you do, you forget all of that because the game is actually a lot of fun. A few days later you try to play with your friends again and it doesn't work. Nothing changed on your end, just won't work. You mess around and get it to work again and have a blast. Repeat cycle until you are frustrated and don't want to play anymore.

At this point in time I can't recommend it just because of the frustration with getting multiplayer to work. Other than that it is fun; when you keep dying it gets old after awhile. Watching your friends die doesn't.

Le jeu vous encourage √† jouer avec des amis, bien plus fun qu'en solo, prenez tout de m√™me garde √† ne pas vous faire tuer par ces pr√©tendus amis. Un saut sur la t√™te et c'en sera termin√© de vos espoirs de terminer cette foutue map que vous avez d√©j√† essay√© 19541 fois.

[ RECOMMENDATION? ]
Do you like 'I Wanna be the' series? then I strongly recommend.
BUT
If you can't hard controlling, You don't have to get this game.

[ CONCLUSION ]
Just not bad, I recommend carefully.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010273830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1444274812}
review:
This game is entirely devoid of anything even resembling a fun and well-designed game.  I really gave this game the benefit of the doubt and went in with the expectation that it would be an exercise in frustration (as most trial-and-error games like this are), but my frustrations were mostly with the poorly-conceived levels and frustratingly bad hitboxes and design.  I made it to the final world before realizing it would not be getting better, and that is entirely my fault.

Please save yourself the money and invest in something better.

review: Bloody Trapland is a fun and fair game. It is relatively easy, and is obviously a game designed to raise your self confidence. author: {'steamid': '76561198133860906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1596833678}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016621386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1452717701}
review:
Tight controls, lots of levels and very challenging. Recommend it if you like punishing platformers. I have one major and a couple of minor concerns with the game that makes it hard for me to recommend it at full price however:

Crouching mid-air
If you crouch by pressing down mid-air you lose the ability to steer and drop straight down. This means that touching down will kill you instantly on any jump or any time you need to dodge traps while falling down. The only explanation I can think of for this is preventing people from cheesing certain levels. It plays no part in any puzzle and has killed me more times than I can count.

The Overworld
I haven't found any way to skip between the worlds. Every time you start up the game you need to move through the entire game world to get to where you left off. A minor annoyance.

"F you"-moments
Hidden blocks smashing you out of nowhere. Not a lot of these and you learn them quickly, but they deserve a (dis)honorable mention as not having random deaths is game design 101.

Multiplayer
Not being able to access the entire game without playing with others is a choice I'm highly skeptical of considering the active player base will dwindle (and probably has already).

author: {'steamid': '76561198082115334', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1586105602}
review: To begin, this game is insanely difficult. However, that is just part of its charm. Bloody Trapland is a very fun platformer, providing lots of challenge. Even features a co-op mode, along with other multiplayer game modes, ensuring that even the most hardcore platforming gurus won't be left bored. Great, simple game that is easy to grasp, however near impossible to master. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139763412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1449330335}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975158316', 'num_games_owned': 966, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1490860832}
review:
Great game for a few reasons!

A platformer you can play with friends online puts this game on a level I cannot find frequently. Being able to troll your friends adds a level of entertainment that you may or may not appreciate. This game is simple and may not last long for you, but at less than $10 I would recommend it if you're on the fence.

What's bad about it? Perhaps it is too simple. Maybe you find the gameplay too frustrating. Or you don't even like the graphics. If I wanna be the guy is so insanely popular there is no reason this shouldn't be, so give it a shot.

A fair warning that if you think the game is easy because you fly through the first world, you have a big shock coming.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994085048', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1436119958}
review:
Bloody Trapland is a hardcore platformer that encourages Cooperative play.

I only played this solo so I won't have that much to say on the multiplayer front.

The game itself is a simple platformer, the only real mechanics are jumping and crouching, however you can use your first jump as an air jump if you fall off a ledge. It is a very challenging game, and I was not able to complete the last level, however I was able to get there and play it for a while in about 5 hours. I feel like the playtime will mostly come from having to repeat the challenging levels over and over again. If you are not up to the challenge, this will probably just frustrate you.

The levels are designed well in that they will make you think very hard in how to approach the different parts of them, and you will get penalized heavily for making mistakes. The game is very cycle based, which is one of my main gripes about the game. If you aren't familiar with cycles, it basically is the concept of things being time based such as moving platforms. The game is full of traps, and a very large portion of them are on a time based system. Because the game is cooperative, the timers are always going, the level does not reset at any point. This can be extremely frustrating. It is normal for cycles to be in platform games, but here it adds to the challenge in an annoying way. Let's say you attempt to do a level right when you load in. You die because you were 2 seconds too fast getting to Trap A. Now you start the level 2 seconds later, however you die to trap B because you were 1 second too slow. This is a constant process of trial and error that becomes more obvious in later levels. There is still a large amount of normal platforming challenge, but I feel the emphasis on cycles as well as the tons of layered time based traps in later levels, adds to a game you will want to stop playing. I feel like this would be made impossible in coop play. Cooperative play would be very fun but I can't imagine you would enjoy it at the end of the game, where you have to make extremely careful decisions about cycles to move on.

There are also a few other multiplayer modes, but as I was playing this solo it wasn't really of interest to me. It still might be fun to try those out with some friends. There is also a level editor, which is always a really cool thing to have in games to keep things fresh and try out your ideas.

There is the main set of about 60 levels but there are also secret levels you can find which can be a neat way to get through worlds.

I don't think there is any story in the game. You're just a bunch of cats jumping around.

[h1]Pros[/h1]

Cooperative Support
Very Challenging
Solid Platforming Mechanics
Large amount of levels including hidden worlds
Extra Multiplayer Game Modes
Level Editor

[h1]Cons[/h1]

Unforgiving or downright impossible to casual players
Multiplayer might be more trouble then it's worth
Cycle Based Level Design
No Story

All in all I did enjoy the game, but I really hated having to "watch the clock" per say just to beat levels. It made me want to stop when I got to the last level just because there were about 20 different timers I had to keep an eye on. If you have some friends that want a very difficult platforming experience, or you yourself are a hardcore platformer lover, you should pick this up

[h1]7.1/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198005212424', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1436283292}
review:
Blooy Trapland is by far a good experience if you like flawless rage gaming
Compared to Super Meat Boy i¬¥ve found a similar joy in it. 

pros

+ Multiplayer up to 4 players!
+ random fireballs of death
+ unrecognizable death traps 
+ blocks of horror, mostly in the finishing line 
+ flawless time attack in race mode (which sets the current map to 
different patterns)
+ smooth gameplay and tight controls (maybe should¬¥ve mentioned this first)
+ Right at the spot Achievements
+ Part of the Soundtrack sounds like it¬¥s right from FF VII & Castlevania
+ cats who got more than 9 lives
+ cats
+ no dogs
+ gore
+ gore & cats
+ gore & cats & no dogs at all!
+ no kitty themed stuff, only the charakters are cats

cons

- actually nothing, i wanted to buy a new controller anyway

review:
[h1]The most ununique game I've played in my life.[/h1]

It sure is challenging, I finished the first two worlds, but aw gawd dem bloodstains are so ugly I turned the gore off because of it, and the soundtracks are earraping materials. I tried to connect to my friend's server but it I couldnt (Time out), I've also tried to join someone else's server with "quickplay" but it also gave me the same result, which is irritating.
Well at least the game has cats so it has that going for it which is nice. [spoiler] Although can't ignore how stupid looking the pink cat is, JUST LOOK AT IT, IT HAS LIPS	[/spoiler]

[h1]Rating: Don't Buy this/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198018655473', 'num_games_owned': 4580, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1435493022}
review:
EDIT: this game in a nutshell - screenshot http://i.imgur.com/EG9KAlj.png

Ok, that's it. I just tried to make game screenshot, because all 4 of us managed to get to harder part of level, but when I pressed F12 game CRASHED. 

This title has potential, if it was on Early Access it would deserve recomendation, but now?
Here are things that are in my opinion UNACCEPTABLE for a "finished" Steam game:

- buggy, sometimes cannons stop shooting, game doesn't recognize that you finished level, taking screenshot for some reason clears level blood or even crashes game
- NO KEY BINDING CONFIGURATION AT ALL and moving with arrows on my keyboard is not comfortable
- only XBox controller is supported, I tried using emulator x360ce and it doesn't work
- on game chat you can't use special characters such as question mark - why?
- it's hard to find online games, because:
.......1) list shows both passworded and open games and you can't filter it 
.......2) most open games are impossible to join, because you get "timed out" error, also game doesn't ping such rooms, most pinged (so I assume working) rooms are password protected, very few open games are pinged and working
.......3) there's no refresh button on list, to do it you have to go back and open online menu again
- with 4 players in game, most of the time you die, because somebody jumped on you, people often do it on purpose, it's irrtating

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=467906215

I guess it won't surprise you that I think this game is frustrating. But the problem is, it's not dying or difficulty that is causing it, but lack of features and bugs. This game is not finished and I can't recommend it. 
Just look on game forum and see how many people got problems with it. And it's a title from 2013.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126157171', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5156, 'last_played': 1706358423}
review:
First off, the game has an amazing soundtrack in my opinion. Try looking up World 3's theme on Youtube if you want. It's by far my favorite. Now, onto more gameplay-related things:

A possible friendship destroyer if you've got that friend who loves to jump on your head and then commit suicide at the end of the level that took you 30 minutes to beat.

Even if you lack any friends to play it with, there's still usually one or two unlocked rooms you can join and make some more friends in. 10 people who I am now friends with on Steam came from random open servers in this game. 

The way I see it, this can either be classified as one of three things: an unfair platformer (troll blocks), an impossible platformer (speed run challenges in race mode that are far more difficult than they should be), or a good time (watching friends rage out). 

If you're an achievement hunter, this game might not be for you because of the speed run challenges. They're all possible (personal experience), but you best be willing to devote a lot of time and accept a lot of failure to do so. 

There's one or two levels that have a bug or two in them, but the game has over 60 campaign levels and 60 more race levels, so the vast majority of levels are bug-free. Some of them even have extremely cheap tactics to complete if you have a friend.

Overall, this game is definitely one of my favorite platformers, but it's no walk in the park on the first playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166234469', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1562296439}
review:
Paid a dollar played it for 1 hour couldn't beat the first level died 9 times too many pussy cat ain't coming back 10/10 would kill some pussy again! 

This game is a bargain doesn't look that great if you watch the video, but it's a you have to actually play it to appreciate it experience insanely difficult makes Donkey Kong looks incredibly easy by comparison which was actually pretty unforgiving itself.

Developers could continue to do a lot more with this game quite frankly though to make it so much better toss in some power ups, abilities, and something like a pow block from mario bros. ;) Toss in 9 character levels for extra cat lives ;) Various things to enhance a all ready stellar and addictive game.

I probably won't spend like 9,000 hours on this game or anything, but a hour or two here or there for a game that costs a $1 is totally worth it even if developers themselves never do anything else to make the game better. It's a comically funny trolling simulator too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062816815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1589176358}
review:
I fell in love with this game immediately. It's a puzzle platformer in which 1 to 4 furry animals must jump, glide, and teleport their way to the goal at the end of each map. But be careful, hit one obsticle and your character explodes into a bloody mess, and you have to go back to the beginning of the current level. Everything has a pattern, everything can be timed, and everything will try to kill you. Good luck :D

NOTE: To host an Online Server that actually works for your friends to join, the host must have Wired connection and their friends must manually enter the host's Public IP Address (Google search "My IP" if you don't know it) to enter. That's how my friends and I play Online anyway. There are other methods on the Steam Community to host servers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118038977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1610575738}
review:
Play with your other people. If you can, with your friends. My boyfriend just bought the 4 pack game and gave it to me and my friends. AWESOME!
Almost died laughing so hard. Not only the levels are kinda hard, they are even worst when you play with someone who's always trying to kill you (oh wait, I'm the one trying to kill them).

10/10  would recommend. It's even better to relax after exams or work. Half an hour of this game is enough to make you laugh and laugh and rage and then die because you are mad and then laugh and laugh.

Go play it. Seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112852224', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1561110749}
review:
Bloody Trapland is a fun co-op game that annoys ur friend by killing him and fucking him in deathmatch.
This game is suggested 10/10. It has 3 pieces of game : Race , Deathmatch , and of course the funniest Adventure.
Each one is good but mostly Deathmatch.
Why? Because it makes u smile so hard that u shit ur pants and go to jail for playing to much.
Adventure : This is funny too because u can jump on ur friend and kill the shit out of him , or u can annoy him by the shitty stories example (LETS SS) and u kill him and he rages quit and he leaves the game , so yeah dont do that.
And the last one Race: U just race with ur friend/s and get through the trapland.

Well this is for me and yes , i suggest this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000417778', 'num_games_owned': 2591, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1434236641}
review:
No es un mal juego pero tampoco ofrece nada m√°s all√° de su sencilla (demasiada) mec√°nica. Ir atravesando pantallas esquivando sierras y plataformas con saltos extremadamente ajustados.

Es como si fuera un Meat Boy con opci√≥n multijugador. Pero donde el factor competici√≥n no conlleva ning√∫n bonus especial, ning√∫n reto. Simplemente el acabar primero el nivel y ya est√°, empiezan autom√°ticamente todos el siguiente.

Si no te gustan los retos de ensayo y error llevados hasta la saciedad, este no es t√∫ juego.

PROS
- El reto de jugarlo con amigos
- La m√∫sica

CONTRAS
- Solo mejor que no...para eso juega a Meat Boy

author: {'steamid': '76561198119144077', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1493260391}
review:
As consumers, some love the way games are crafted in this modern day era. Objectives, checkpoints, someone narrating to you which direction one should go. This game, however, takes one back to the days of old, where you simply have one objective: to get from point A to point B... without getting cut by buzzsaws, shot by turrets, burned by lava, impaled by spikes (need I go on?)

Those who enjoy a challenge, and enjoy thinking out every single step and movement will enjoy this game, because it is indeed the difference between life and death. And while there is absolutely no story to be told of, I doubt that really matters because if you're at all like I am... you'll spend more time getting a headache and just trying to figure out that one... exact... jump, or that one... exact... step to excel past that random thing that killed you last time. 

All in all, it's a fun little game, and worth the money, especially now since level creation has been integrated, and if you have a buddy, it's even more enjoyable to watch them react after countless deaths, and as blood sprays and drenches the landscape. I wish you luck if you pursue this purchace, you're going to need it, because what this game offers is truly... a bloody trapland (I had to...)

review:
My review fro Bloody Trapland:

PROS:
-A really fun time waster
-Gory
-Very cheap (atleast on the Summer Sale)

CONS:
-Need controllers to play more than 1 on Local Co-op
-Very hard (Not really a real 'CONS' but i still added it for fun ;)
-Couldnt find any more CONS xD

But overall i recommend it. 7/10

review:
Has a very similar feel to Super Meat Boy but now imagine trying to get through every level with 3 friends consistently trying to kill you repeatedly while the levels become more challenging as you progress. 

This game is absolutely fantastic especially when playing with friends. Many laughs were had and had an absolute blast playing it. Haven't messed with the level editor yet but it sounds amazing what you can probably do with it.

For 1$ you'd be a fool not to pick this game up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064009469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2635, 'last_played': 1644095741}
review:
I'd like to say before listing the pros and cons that I absolutely love this game. Definitely worth getting.

Pros : 
-Simple yet very challenging campaign.
-Multiplayer is utilised well(you can't get into secret levels unless you co-operate with teammates)
-Secret levels!
-Fluid gameplay, nothing really strange happens under normal conditions.
-Very nice graphics and in-game music
-Almost zero random events which kill you like in most platformers

Cons :
-Multiplayer can be very glitchy when the ping between you and the player is higher than let's say 100ms(bullets curving from their paths rather than being delayed...)

That's all that I can think of for now! Also, one thing to note. You should definitely play this in multiplayer. I found myself playing the game and enjoying it a lot more with others. Sometimes it isn't fun failing over and over unless somebody is doing it with you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007668325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1459779276}
review: Almost a worthwild venture. However the hardcoded Ping Time out makes this a dud for me. Honestly should have the option to toggle this off especially when prior posts have suggested that the creator would be addressing this issue about a year or so ago. If you're wanting to play with people overseas I'd stay clear of this. The game itself looks enjoyable plays alright but sadly turned up a waste in this consumer's instance without the Ping toggle option.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052412824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1459779195}
review:
Jumped and bought this game for me and my friends. Only to find out that we are unable to play the game due to High ping //Time Out issues.

There is so far no fix to this from what we searched on the web. 
There was a forum post on the dev.. getting a option to edit the ping time outs... Which was like 3 years ago.
I am able to play so many games with my friends, with 360 ping. But apperently this game does not allow you to even connect with such a ping

author: {'steamid': '76561197970676862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1454864111}
review:
I just had to stop playing this to write a review. And I'm not doing those very often, let alone getting such urgent impulse to actually close the game for it. But this game deserves it... I guess. Well, I'm just an hour in, reached only W3-1 but oh boy, it gives me some sweats ‚Äì sweats of joy!
Never have I played such a challenging yet achievable plattformer.  Admittedly it's not my preferred genre of choice on my computer, and console gamers could eventually prove me otherwise, but I'm having a blast!

The gameplay is as easy as it gets ‚Äì jump, run, duck, avoid deadly objects, just don't die reaching the exit. One lvl is merely one screen, no scrolling. One world has ten screens (plus some bonus stages), as far as I can tell, I'm in the last lvl of the 2nd world. For the adventure mode that is. There are also a race and a deathmatch mode which are obviously multiplayer modes. I've only tried adventure so far, as I'm testing candidates for the next local gaming party, but lacking a buddy right now. And this one looks very promising although you might gather a more experienced crowd. Now, it is hard as stated before and on entering a lvl you might think ‚Äúhow I'm ever going to make this?!‚Äù. But you are! It may take a while though*g* It's always doable, never unfair. It takes some plattfoming skill and timing. Controls are precise and responsive. Levels are riddled with ‚Äì well ‚Äì traps... where some of those aren't visible when you enter a new screen. But you won't succeed on your first attempt anyway... so.
The graphics are ‚Äì as you can see on the screenshots ‚Äì retro styled, inspired by the 16 bit era. They're not particularly unique, but by no means dull or ugly. The gore effect which covers the environment with more and more blood as you're being constantly crushed by the fist of doom or saw blade of horror gives a weird sense of accomplishment. It's got a great soundtrack, I don't like the soundeffects though. Often they don't fit or sound awfully generic.

I definitely recommend Bloody Trapland for solo players and I will vote for it on the next game night with friends.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198044950151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1423609153}
review:
Not a game with much substance unfortunately.

The game's gimmick is that it is very hard. That in itself is not a bad thing, but Bloody Trapland is not designed around fair challenge, it is design to unfairly kill you and frustrate you.

The mechanics are serviceable and the controls are responsive, though this does not help the game much since the levels themselves are designed to screw you over and constantly "pull the rug" from underneath you. Also, the graphics are ugly. The graphics are low fidelity, and the estethic just looks like a cheap game taken from Newgrounds anno 2008.

The game does become fun if you have some friends to play with however. Getting frustrated is not much fun, but hearing/witnessing others losing their marbles over this game is hillarious. You'll learn a bunch of new swears, have a great time making fun of your friend's suckage, and enjoy watching them suffer. Comedy gold!

Despite the fun in multiplayer, i feel the game does not offer enough for the current price tag. There is just not much to it if you are forced to play alone, and there is little variety to be found (normal platforming levels, races, and deathmatch. More similar to eachother than one might would tink). Therefore, I cannot recommend this game at the current price tag. If you can get it on sale and get a few friends to join you, then sure, go ahead. Otherwise, it is better to just stay away.

NOT RECOMMENDED, unless you have friends to play with and it is on sale.

review:
10/10
Bloody Trapland is a beautifully amazing, rageful platformer!
             
             -Many components make this successfully entertaining. The game does get harder, but your 
              determination to complete a level also grows stronger as the game progresses. The 3 diverse 
              gamemodes make it fun to play with a group of friends or even some strangers.
             
             -Easy hosting set up for online playing with friends or strangers, though hosting does not work                          
              for some (unsure what is who is at fault).

author: {'steamid': '76561198069731617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1476871260}
review:
This "game" is purely a nerves' breaker. If you give to to your children, it will either make them smash the monitor, or make them criminals. It requires ninja-like reflexes. Every time you die or get killed, it immediately restarts in the beginning of each of those hard maps. You should not buy it, according to my opinion. It is not worth the money(at the time being 10 euros).

P.S. The chatting system is awful as well, because you cannot even use fullstops or even question marks! By the way, to type something, you must press "Enter"... The letters are very BIG and in the playing area.
The connection to an internet game is virtually impossible, due to connection problems all the time.
The keys are not redefinable.
And lastly(for now at least), the maps in the game are sort of wrong-invisible to some players, making them unplayable.

That' s all for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127176965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1461272125}
review:
Well, it's a platformer, so you know what to expect. It isn't a "bad" game per say, it's just that the game in general is somewhat lacking. The levels aren't very difficult or too different from one another. They have added a level editor, which is pretty nice i guess, but there are much better platform games to do this in. The music is pretty great, i'll give them that. 
There isn't anything about this game that makes it stand out from any other platformer on the market currently. The controls are very simple: Jump, move to the right, move to the left and crouch. The options menu is also very lacking, not that the options menu needs to be grand for a game like this, but it helps if some things can be tweaked. The only things that could be changed regarding graphics was the resolution and "effects", whatever that entails. However, you could turn the effects all the way from ultra to off, with no noticable difference, so i am still confused as to what it actually does. The texture quality makes this game looks like it should be on a flash games site, like Newgrounds or Mousebreaker, not a site like Steam.
Overall, this is a game that could be played on co-op with a friend, but it doesn't have much about it that is compelling. It's more of a "Get drunk with your friends and bugger about on a game" kind of game, if you get my meaning. 
Anyway, mediocre game with nothing that sets it apart from other platformers. This game was the winner of the Game Concept Challenge 2011, but it doesn't seem like the devs have added anything much to the original game back in 2011.


(This is the opinion of someone who doesn't enjoy or play many platform games, so take my opinion with a barrel of salt.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014781071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1417360056}
review: Very few people will likely find any real value in playing this game. Unless you are a 2d platformer obsessed maniac who craves rigid platforming challenge and doesn't mind poorly made graphics set to dated mario trope aesthetics this game is not worth your money or your time. I bought it very cheap during a winter sale for $2 but I can't even justify wasting any more time playing this game. This game feels like a bad/mediocre first game that the developer either should have released for free or should have released as an alpha and searched feedback before making it a commercial release. Definitely a very niche product. Purchase at your own risk, but for me it's a 'No'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003058832', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1417572053}
review:
Im not sure about this game but here's a delicious chocolate cake recipe. 


:INGREDIENTS FOR CAKE:

2 cups white sugar

1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour

3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder

1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda

1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder

1 teaspoon salt

2 eggs

1 cup milk

1/2 cup vegetable oil



:INGREDIENTS FOR FROSTING:

2 teaspoons vanilla extract

1 cup boiling water

3/4 cup butter

1 1/2 cups unsweetened cocoa powder

5 1/3 cups confectioners' sugar

2/3 cup milk

1 teaspoon vanilla extract


:INSTRUCTIONS:

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9 inch cake pans.

2. Use the first set of ingredients to make the cake. In a medium bowl, stir together the sugar, flour, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Add the eggs, milk, oil and vanilla, mix for 3 minutes with an electric mixer. Stir in the boiling water by hand. Pour evenly into the two prepared pans.

3. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven, until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to cool completely.

4.To make the frosting, use the second set of ingredients. Cream butter until light and fluffy. Stir in the cocoa and confectioners' sugar alternately with the milk and vanilla. Beat to a spreading consistency.

5. Split the layers of cooled cake horizontally, cover the top of each layer with frosting, then stack them onto a serving plate. Frost the outside of the cake.

review:
I was waiting for the day that this game would finally come to Steam. The second it did, I just HAD to purchase it.

To be successful at this game, you have to be patient, calm, and read the stage. Bear in mind that even the smallest thing on the map can get you killed. And of course, steady hands are the key to victory.

With friends, the game gets harder (Yes, you can kill your own friends, intentionally or unintentionally) but this makes it more fun. 
This is definitely worth the try and the buy.
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198027521525', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1119, 'last_played': 1421229204}
review:
w0w.

Just sent a mail to the devs with the picture: http://prntscr.com/5r6gxl

Finally beat the game with a friend.

Pros:
- IT'S FUCKING HARD!
- Gameplay is very sharp and precise; just what you'd expect from a good action platformer.
- Tons of laughter and fun to be had if you play with a friend.
- Beat a level? Such satisfaction, much scream, w0w.

Cons
- IT'S FUCKING HARD!
- Some very strange bugs occur at times. Sometimes the game hiccups and the order of things gets messed up. A little unstable, in general.
- If you want to beat the game, be ready to put in 15~ hours to it.
- I wouldn't personally enjoy this game by myself on singleplayer. There's no story or characted development, it's pure action platforming.
- The music gets a bit repetitious.
- Playing with a friend is not co-op. Each player is trying not to step on the other's head, since that means death for the one being stepped on. So, it's more like two people are playing a single player game on the same level. But still fun, nonetheless.

I think we died a total of 50k times during our 16 hours of gameplay. [b]7/10[/b], would die again.

review:
Ever hated somebody so much you wish they would literally, go a little coo coo?

Well this is the game you shall send to them.

It's fun at first, Then when you get to hell it kind off becomes a well...
Grind.

The races are quite enjoyable.
Haven't done deathmatch yet but seems like it'll be great fun.

Pretty decent game, but with way to many near "perfect" timing situations
that you either have started moving at the right moment for the entire map run.
Or you're pretty much.
Shit outta luck.

Great game though, worth a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044285280', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1571875919}
review:
Blood. Traps. The name of the game really tells you what type of game you're going to get yourself into. This game starts off quite simple for a platformer. However, it quickly shows you why it's known as "Bloody Trapland". Traps everywhere attept to turn your cute little furry companion into a bloody pulp. Levels can quickly turn red, and when playing 4 Player coop in adventure mode, only hillarity insues. 

I gotta say, there isn't many negatives I can give this game. Really fun for people who enjoy challenging platformers, and for anyone who loves torturing themselves. 5/5

I highly recomment playing it with a friend or two, as there is team killing, which can lead to really funny moments, but can be a negative when playing with trolls online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012363945', 'num_games_owned': 2117, 'num_reviews': 404, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1606926039}
review:
This is a game that falls into the category 'if it doesn't exist - it would have to be created sooner or later'. 

Game is a good follow up to the success of Super Meat Boy and Escape Goat etc. Play singleplayer obstacle course - which basically works as training for the real deal: Up to 4 player multiplayer mayhem. 

Lots of rage and also lots of good times and laughs. I would not change anything in this game except the MP game listing that shows games that are left hanging and give no ping (i.e. they dont exist). 

Good luck trying to beat the game solo or with your 'soon to be ex-friends'. 

9.8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198086867957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1526265438}
