If your looking for an easy platformer, this is not the place.  This is one of the hardest games I have ever played, but I dont regret playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021695041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1185, 'last_played': 1418653427}
review:
Anfangs denkt man sich, dass Bloody Trapland ein Gelegenheits 2D Jump n Run spiel ist. Falsch gedacht. 
Nach 3 Tagen das Spiel durchgespielt / gesuchtet mit √ºber 30 std. Und das ist schon lange nicht EndContent. Race / Deathmatch ist der Hammer und macht genauso S√ºchtig wie das Adventure.

Nur zu empfehlen, ist sein Geld auf jeden Fall Wert.

Einziger Nachteil: Die vielen Crashes

author: {'steamid': '76561198051992495', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1570039756}
review:
[h1]If you are a calm easy going gamer that doesn't like to rage quit then this is totally for you.[/h1] Just dodge spikes, fists and bullets to get past the stage is no problem. Actually that's a lie, you rage, rage and then more rage once you get to like world 3. These can be easily passed with friends but then you're stuck at world 5 and you are all raging on Skype/TS3/Curse together and it is really fun. I got it for the very purpose of helping a friend out and 5 hours (to date) later I took it to college and showed more people how addictive it can get yet very frustrating.
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8BqEyYVvtiw]Jerma985 & STAR_ on Bloody Trapland[/url]
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1KbmTIAKX24]2nd part to Jerma985 & STAR_ on Bloody Trapland[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198065295092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1416271966}
review: DISCLAIMER: Don't play this game if you have conditioning heart problems or any other sorts of high stress related health problems because you are going to FLIP YOUR SHIT! Even the second level is pretty intense for a second level. The controls are easy and there are many ways to use them, you can play multiplayer with your friends, and you can "Accidentally" kill them by jumping on their heads. This game is a fun experience that leaves you with such relief to leave the blood-filled area you have played for the last 30 minutes to the next level, which brings a short-lived euphoria of seeing a new level that you can view and stress over how to pass the beginning of your brand new Bloody Trapland. I give this game 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198013971156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1416648021}
review:
Do not buy this junk! I'm glad I only wasted $2.50. The game claims to have Online coop but the only problem is the programmer failed badly at setting up a friendly interface for it. It's very difficult to have your friends join the game you host. You have no options at all when it comes to hosting a game. Also you can't just simply host a game then thru steam have your friends click on "Join Game" That feature does not exist. Your friends have to try to find your server that you hosted in the servers list and of course like I said you have no options for setting up a game so this means you cannot create a server name. The server name is your User Name. It's very unlikly your friends will even see your server being hosted. Another way to join is by Ip Address which one isnt giving to you. 
Online Coop is very diffuclt to set up. Bad programming skills. Also 9/10 times it will have a connection failed or timed out for joining servers on the server list. 

The actual game play is bad as well. Yes it's a simple game but its missing a lot of physics and basic math. Things don't line up quite right and it's difficult to control your character. If your okay with a very very VERY basic and dummed down game then this is the game for you. I suggest buying it at $1.00 not for $10.00 or even $2.50. The programmer lacks basic programming skills but I can't complain too much because well....The game shows how far the skills went. 

Overall I say 3/10. Yeah its thats bad. It can be fun if your super bored but you might get more entertainment by playing with your toes. Good luck!

author: {'steamid': '76561198118566119', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1440295449}
review: Do you have three close friends that like to play games? Do all of you like platfomers? Do you like the multiplayer chaos of New Super Mario Bros Wii? And finally do you want a game to ruin those friendships? Then this is the game for you. With some of the hardest platformering I have ever seen, plus up to three other players to either work with or against you as you try to go on a grand adventure and do whatever else token cats like to do. Staring Jack the badass one, Blanky the sweet and inocent one, Henry the bristish one, and Jazzy the "groovy" one. There will always be that one more level you just can't beat... So whether you want to piss yourself off, or destroy friendships, this is the game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981055338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 1542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1652667029}
review:
[h1]Jump 'n Bump 2 (with cats)[/h1]

Level designs aren't astonishing but still, it's fun hardcore platformer which reminded me Jump 'n Bump and Super Meat Boy with cooperative mode(s). But it has also some flavor from "Jinsei Owata Daibouken" and "Shobon no Akushon" in some levels.

Art style is good and reminded me 90's cartoons. Game itself represent a DOS game with clean visuals. Blood effects are awesome. Tracker musics are great, my favourites are menu music, first level and castle themes.

I read the negative comments about online problems but it seems like online play a little bit fixed since last year but it still has some problems like connection timeouts or connection fail errors (i don't know if it is my dormitory internet or not though). There are enough amount of players and rooms but mostly they are private and they don't play Race or Deathmatch but Adventure mode; i don't know why. Hotseat (local) play is always available.

Cooperative adventure mode is a little bit chaotic. You accidentally (or purposedly?) bump and kill your partner and/or prevent them to reach their goal or they do the same to you. Also they distract you because, you know, there is something moving over there or something funny happens. Time by time you or your partners activate a trap and you can't handle the timing of it and die. But these kind of incidents make the game more funnier.

There is also a level editor named Aftershock but there are no guides about it and it's not so user friendly. You can find custom levels to play on Steam Workshop. Just hit the green subscribe button.

I bought it for 2 bucks and i can recommend it to you if you like hardcore platformers.

066 108 111 111 100 121 084 114 097 110 110 121 108 097 110 100 046 109 112 052

review: BattleBlock Theater is just five dollars more, requires no massive fucking in-game key, the multiplayer works, it has characters that don't look like they were ripped straight from a twelve year old's Deviantart page, graphics that are both gorgeous and satisfyingly cartoonish, a storyline that is actually existant, hillarious narration, and has great singleplayer AS WELL as co-op. Well worth the five bucks extra, in my humble opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995671518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1407128768}
review:
This game is a cute little hardcore platformer. If you're a fan of pure platforming, this game is decent, if a bit frustrating at times. It is not on the same level as Super Meat Boy or the I Wanna Be The Guy games, especially with it's lack of any sort of boss battles, but there is still fun to be had here.

I played through this game in co-op with one friend. The 'co-opness' in this game is somewhat nullified by the fact that you can easily kill the other players by jumping on their heads, so you end up just taking turns attempting to complete each stage, making sure you don't both reach the same section at the same time and accidentally kill each other. It can be a bit fun repeatedly killing the other play to vent your frustrations at times, though, and the frustration of dying in this game is mitigated by the fact that your character instantaneously respawns at the start of the stage when you die.

All in all, an okay game if you enjoy hardcore pure platformers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039359279', 'num_games_owned': 2091, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1515369399}

review:
A hardcore jump n run platformer made in the style of super meat boy

Controls are super accurate

I do not like the player model (you play as cats or epic sir gentleman cat)
Lots of stupid invisible traps that force trial and error on lots of levels
Levels get way to punishing and difficulty by the end

Stil one of the best platformers on steam, I recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198110446014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1427642110}
review: I love complicated puzzle games mixed in with cute characters that blow up into bloody messes with every mistake you make! This game is fun and makes you realize that your mistakes hurt other people. I would recommend this game to anyone looking for a funny game to play with friends. I would NOT recommend this game as a stress reliever and I would not recommend playing if you are a violent rager.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087552066', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1414869290}
review:
I was very dissapointed when I played this game for the first time, It looked way better when PewDiePie played.

Reasons I hate it:
1) Online Requires Hamachi

2) Online keeps disconnecting every 1-5 mins

3) Sometimes you can't even join the game

4) Controls can't be configured

5) Game Can't be played with origanal computer gamepads

6) Just a shit game

Honestly, this game sould cost like 4.99, not 9.99. Bigest waste of money ever

review: This game....To start with you will enjoy the hell out of it, finding it fun and challenging and a bit rageworthy when you die, but then as you progress it starts to slowly eat away at your diginity and your soul making you smash your keyboard everytime you die because you didn't notice that you were a few milimetres closer to a spinning blade of death than you thought. But in all seriousness this is a brilliant co-op game which breaks down the boundaries of friendships due to the ability to thwart your teammates progress by bouncing on their heads

author: {'steamid': '76561198104355140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1396745512}
review: ....This game is a freaking rage game all the way... not recommended for those who base their enjoyment in games on how quickly they make progress. This game also gets better and more frustrating when playing with others. The later maps are freakin' insane!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974137781', 'num_games_owned': 1260, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1610600652}
review:
The single player is fun. It's difficult as hell, but is a lot of fun.

The multiplayer is where it shines. I've had such incredible fun playing this with friends. For such a simplistic game, your platforming skills will be put to the test here. Not often enough has a game made me feel proud of myself after completing each level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040840924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1656128254}
review:
This game is very fun and I reccomend it to people who like Super Meat Boy and VVVVVV. It's Better to play with a 2 - 4 multiplayer, Single player can get very lonley :(. But honstly, just buy it with a price tag of 10 dollars (You can't go wrong) I would even buy this game if it was 15$ or 20$. 
Overall = 9/10

review:

10/10

O jogo √© bem divertido, m√°s tambem chega ter parte muito dificeis e impossiveis. √â claro que isto da qualidade ao jogo, m√°s bem que poderia manerar um pouco n√©.

Sobre o fator de jogar online...Horrivel.
√â quase impossivel achar jogadores em server, e mais dificil ainda achar algum server que funcione, quando funciona o server tem senha. Eles realmente poderiam melhorar o sistema de Host deles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057765570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1423996523}
review:
Engaging, frustrating fun!
It's a simple platformer where you have to get past the traps to the exit of the screen, similar to the Meat Boy franchise. You have endless lives and just throw yourself at the traps until you can get through. You can play up to 4 players on the same map, but there is little you can do to help each other. Instead, if one of you beats the level, you all advance to the next level together. So sometimes it can end up as a bit of a race rather than cooperation.

Fun in short doses. Can be too frustrating if you play several hours in one sitting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121178329', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1618297342}
review: One word... frustrating. Why would you want to get a game that is frustrating? Well, no matter how frustrating it is, you keep playing. Addicting. Especially at the end of a long series of death in a level, you are satisfied with complete relief but, keep going. This game is a series of levels/stages. In which you are some sort of cat, you play through frustrating stages that brings usually death. There is a reason why it is called "Bloody Trapland" because when you die, there will be blood. I would recommend this game because it can be fun some days and god awful other days though. It is worth it's low $10 price that brings a feeling from the unfair flash game series, if you are familiar, as they are as well a platformer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982074343', 'num_games_owned': 1423, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1402775658}
review: Have you ever played Super Meat Boy and thought, "this is fun, but I wish I could play in multiplayer and with cats?" Well look no further, this game is for you! A simple but deliciously difficult game you can play with up to three other players both locally and online, Bloody Trapland is easily one of the most fun deliciously difficult games I've ever played. You can play solo which can be fun, but the game truly shines in multiplayer. Just prepare to die ... a lot!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972238650', 'num_games_owned': 1229, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1403182381}

author: {'steamid': '76561198088048466', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1567829125}
review: Bloody Trapland is both fun and cooperatively challenging. Being a fan of platformer games, this somewhat reminds me of the classic NES "Super Mario Brothers". At first glance I thought the game would be similar to the Rage Game "Cat Mario" but this just proves the saying "Don't judge a book by it's cover". Bloody trapland has the uniqueness of a game that no one has created before. The puzzles do in fact get more and more challenging as you progress through eash level, but they're not impossible to complete. I would recommend playing this with 1 to 2 more people, but be warned it can get a little messy if you accidentally jump on a friends head.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042277590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1483155429}
review: Although Bloody Trapland originally looks promising, it quickly loses its appeal. The game is no more difficult than any typical platformer, with its "difficulty" originating from unclever traps (blocks you cannot see crushing you). Instead of the skill game you would expect from a "difficult platformer," the game feels more like a memorization game - memorize the location of the traps and develop a muscle memory to work through them. Also, multiplayer is mediocre at best - it's far too easy to accidentally kill your teammates in adventure. For those of you seeking the deathmatch option, it really doesn't work with less than four players. In my experience, two players just led to a spawn camper (with correct timing you'll instantly die upon spawning) and with three two players can easily team up and ruin the fun for another player. Finally, the ambience of the game is lacking a great deal of work. The tiles, music, and characters feel childish. No particular theme is accomplished, as many games which choose a more "retro" look. I would avoid Bloody Trapland - It's not worth the cash. Maybe pick it up if it ever goes on a super sale.

review:
Looking for a Game, in which you wanna flip the hell out of a ton of tables and scream obscure words at your screen? Well look no further, my fellow friends. This game starts off easy, but gets increasingly harder and harder with each upcoming level. You will need nothing but patients and 100% concentration to get pass each bloody level. What makes things better, you got FREAKING CATS. ADORABLE LOOKING FELINES that gives out that kawaii uguu animu feel, till you start dying, and blood splatters all over the damn place (poor things). So most likely....you'll be taking your anger irl and fustrations in screaming at these poor fluffy critters. 

10/10 would flip more tables

author: {'steamid': '76561198089478476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1404857757}
review:
Well, this game is not for everyone...Mainly because of its difficulty, that is HELL!!! If you are used to games like Super Meat Boy, you will be prepared for "Bloody Trapland"...But for those who aren't, well....Good luck my friend...Because it's very common to be stuck in a level, keep dying hundreds and hundreds of times (no exaggerating), before giving up (more common) or going to the next level, where you will die twice the times...
But don't think this is a negative aspect of the game...In fact, this is the main objective of it... CHALLENGE YOU TO YOUR LIMIT!
In that point, my dear, the game succeeds...Ohhh...How it does! A mix of love and hate...You will see...Muahahaha!!! >:)

------> 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198008669131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1447776036}
review:
Wie meine Vorg√§nger schon beschrieben haben spielt es sich so √§hnlich wie Super Meatboy. (zumindest ist der Frustfaktor und die Schwierigkeit auf einem Level) Sp√§testens ab der vorletzen Welt habe ich aufgeh√∂rt zuz√§hlen wie oft ich laut geworden bin aber das hat das Gef√ºhl wenn man endlich ein Level geschafft hat umso besser gemacht. Aus diesem Grund macht es auch sehr S√ºchtig mit dem Gedanken einfach dieses Dresspiel endlich zu schaffen und es einfach nur zu sagen "F!ck dich Spiel!",gefolgt von einem Controller wurf in die Ecke. 

Tja was soll ich noch gro√üartig zum Spiel sagen... Das Pixelblut, die Fallen, die Texturen bringen ein sch√∂nes Retrofeeling, √§hnlich wie bei "Rogue Legacy". Es besitzt insgesammt 6 Welten und der Schwierigkeitsgrad nimmt immer mehr zu. Es gibt in manchen Welten 2 Ausg√§nge die einem auf der Weltenkarte auf eine andere Route f√ºhren und somit zu anderen Leveln, manche erreicht man nur mit Hilfe eines anderen Spielers. Ich habe ca. 3-4 h f√ºr die "Kampange" gebraucht und ich denke ich bin Mittelma√ü (weder Pro noch Noob), doch danach ist noch lange nicht Schluss. Es gibt noch f√ºr jede Welt 10 Rennlevel (also 60) die man so schnell wie m√∂glich abschlie√üen muss.

F√ºr Leute die nicht schnell aufgeben und wirklich Durchhalteverm√∂gen haben ist es genau das Richtige um sich selbst und sein K√∂nnen zu testen. Ein Punkt muss ich allerdings abziehen da mir die Hitbox manchmal irgendwie verbuggt vorkam. (manchmal hat sie sich so pissig das man nur die Falle mit einem Pixel ber√ºhren brauch um zu sterben und manchmal bis zum Virtel drinne steht und nicht stirbt)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025514848', 'num_games_owned': 1561, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1390466960}
review:
This game is like Super Meat boy but with friends. Fun by yourself, but it's better with friends. [spoiler]Some secret levels you NEED a friend to reach.[/spoiler] Some levels are made easier with a friend because you can jump off their heads to reach higher places and you can use them to mess with the trap's timing.

For a platformer, controls aren't as tight as I'd like, but they're not unbearable. This game is harder than super meat boy, in my opinion.

Public multiplayer is pretty dead, but I don't exactly play during steam's peak hours. It's better with people you actually know, anyways. It has online AND/OR local multiplayer, meaning if you have some gamepads lying around you can connect them and have some buddies play with you in your house/their house while you play with some buddies off in Sneedville, all on the same screen and in the same game. If you do decide to play with friends online, be sure to set a password for your lobby. Learned that the hard way. Online multiplayer also seems a bit laggy for the host, but my internet's subpar at best so beware, those with average connections.

Very fun with some minor issues that don't detract too much from the overall game.

9/10

review:
It's fun, but it has the WORST MULTIPLAYER SEVICE EVER!! I can't play it with my friends, even though I did what they said I should do. If they don't fix it, I wish I never bought it.
If you're looking for a very hard game singleplayer game of this natura, buy Super Meat Boy. Bloody Trapland is Super Meat Boy with multiplayer, but when it doesn't work as it should, it seems like a waste of money.
Buy SMB if you want to play alone, and don't anything if you want to play multiplayer.

review:
This game is punishment for all your sins..

It literally is one of the hardest Mother Effing games I have ever become a slave to. I spent the whole day playing this game and got to world 5. It was there that I realized my priorities are not in order. It was there that I realized that this game is not just a game. It is god punishing me for all that Ive done. It is lucifer calling out to me. It is one of the most rediculous games that I could've ever dreamed of playing. 

Don't consider this as my way of telling you to go the other way. Please, join me in in the suffering. You wont regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028072696', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1656851894}
review: At first, do not take the hours i spent for full, i played it with 3 other friends on an other account. So i was looking for a challenging game on Steam. The problem is that there is more crap than anywhere else. But i still kept looking and I finally found this. I already saw that a year ago on youtube but back then it wasnt on steam so i ignored it. Took me quite a long time to accept that the price was really high, but i took the risk. I have to say that the first world of the game is realy easy and you should not take it as a full reason to judge the game. But if you continue this game, it will kill you mentally. Seriously, world 5 and 6 destroyed us beyond our imagination. I see myself not as casual player and i still had some trouble in 5 and 6. There was one level in world 5 where we needed 5 goddamn hours to complete it. I personally think that you get a lot of good challenges for the relatively high price. If you are really looking for some good old classical rape, get. this. game.

review: This game is a challenging puzzle platforming co-op game. Yet it is a very interesting and fun platformer when you play it with friends. For only $10 this game is worth it. If you need a reference to what type a game this is it really is just Super Meat Boy except with multiplayer. This game also has 3 different modes. Adventure, Race, & Deathmatch. So if you would like to have a good 'ol challenge with some friends to back you up... this is your game. Trust me when you play with multiplayer and you use skype or steam private voice chat, you will have a LOT of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041706124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1453274334}
review:
An excrutiatingly difficult Unfair Platformer.

The gameplay mechanics in this game make sure that each level can be completed... Eventually. Hidden traps, bad timing and getting jumped on by friends means that you will die, and die often. The controls are responsive and the traps can be predicted, after some time playing the game. 

A very good game to play Multiplayer, you will almost assuredly annoy your friends with all of the Deaths-by-head-jumps. A good laugh, since you will probably die in the next few seconds anyway.

Cute characters, and the way that the blood stains the walls when they inevitably die, make the art style of this game quite funny, against expectations. You will either laugh or swear at each death.

I did enjoy this game at the begining. I played it with a friend and we had a lot of fun with it... untill we got exhausted. This is a hard game to play for any length of time, as the outrageous dificulty level drove us mad by the third world. If you have a bunch of friends and want to spend some time doing some therapeutic screaming, this is a great game for it. Single player is, somehow, more frustrating because you can't turn to your friend and complain about the difficulty.


Some shameless self promotion now. I did a Let's Play with my friend for this game. If you want to see some of the multiplayer madness that this game provides, please click this link:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nuKVwLAd1XY&list=PLixtp40jTIEqwV1trT7rtec9tKBmCStZe&index=1

author: {'steamid': '76561198064732187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1397688104}
review: This game is really just Super Meat Boy, but you can play with up to 4 people. You have more than just going through obstacles, and these courses are more than just trying to survive and speed through at the same time, you have to slowly progress and take your time with these courses, so it requires some thinking effort. Like I said, you have more than just going through obstacles, theres a racing mode which is the main game, but the first person to get to the end of the level wins that round. Theres also a deathmatch mode where you kill each other by jumping on your enemies heads (which can get really fun). This game is a must play for you and your friends. Buy this game
